Address: The shop is named "Wuchen Family Red Bean King Small Shop" and it is located at No. 2 Comprehensive Building, Zhonghe Road.

Roasted Red-Skin Duck: Extremely fragrant and delicious, with exceptionally crispy skin. The meat is also very lean, tender, and seasoned with a savory and sweet flavor. Address: This establishment is called Xiao Ma Roast Duck, and it is located at Building No. 7, Huasheng Residential Area, Xinwu Road.

1403058.caption: What are the local delicacies recommended by the residents of Rizhao? Please inform me with illustrations and text.

Lanshan Greenhouse Tofu Stewed Fish

The restaurant is located inside a large greenhouse, just ten minutes from the seaside. It has a spacious courtyard with ample parking, and inside there are square tables with small stools. I particularly enjoy their braised fish, which embodies the authentic flavor of old Rizhao. One of the more frequently ordered dishes is the Cotton Forest Fish Braised with Potatoes, which is stewed to perfection but can be a bit salty at times. Additionally, the miscellaneous fish potstickers, tofu potstickers, and seafood steamed buns are all excellent choices that are unlikely to disappoint.

"Fat Noodles Restaurant is the local's most feared-to-close noodle shop. Every time you go, it is always packed. As soon as you walk in, you can see an aunt making noodles. Their specialty is the Braised Beef Noodles with large chunks of beef. It's incredibly satisfying to eat, and you can even add more beef, which is sold by weight. The restaurant is about ten minutes away from the seaside."

Drunken Jianghu

This is a local favorite for fishers' dishes, with a wide variety of seafood. The environment is very nice, and all the seafood is clearly marked with prices. You can find almost all common types of seafood here. Their sea intestine rice is a must-try! Sometimes when we have a large group, we order two portions directly. The Xiangmihu location offers shrimp pot stickers and assorted seafood hot pot, which I order every time I go.

Da Tu Hao Affordable Seafood Barbecue is a small, down-to-earth shop located right next to the Lanshan Greenhouse mentioned above. It features a series of grilled seafood dishes that are popular among Rizhao locals and is reasonably priced. Personally, I particularly enjoy the grilled eel, which is crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, a truly delightful surprise with every bite. Additionally, their specialty includes grilled oysters and grilled scallops, promising a satisfying and indulgent dining experience.

The duck products from Wang Dachui are what I order every week. I've recommended them to friends around me, and everyone says they are delicious. They have a sweet and spicy flavor, and the meat is tender, not tough. The more you eat, the more you crave them. Their vegetarian dishes are also very tasty and are perfect for a late-night snack.

1403004.caption: What Guangdong-style snacks are recommended by locals? Please provide the information with images and text.
Wonton Noodles: Also known as wonton noodles, thin shrimp noodles, or large shrimp noodles, it is a specialty snack of Guangdong Province and belongs to the Cantonese cuisine category.

Shrimp Dumplings: Cantonese crystal shrimp dumplings hold an "supreme" status within Guangzhou's culinary scene. They feature a translucent skin and large shrimp fillings. The half-moon-shaped dumplings contain shrimp, meat, and bamboo shoots, offering a delectable and smooth texture with a rich umami flavor.

Guangzhou Rice Noodle Roll: It is one of Guangzhou's traditional snacks with a long history, originating during the Qing Dynasty. It is made from white rice and glutinous rice, ground into a fine rice slurry and then steamed. It is typically served with sweet sauce, chili sauce, seafood sauce, etc. The fillings are diverse and include shrimp, scallops, seafood, lean meat, and egg.

Cantonese-Style Mooncakes: Originating from Guangdong, these mooncakes are mainly sweet in flavor, with a soft and flaky texture. The fillings include lotus seed paste, red bean paste, mixed nuts, and others. The mixed nuts mooncake is a representative of Cantonese-style mooncakes, named for its filling which includes a variety of ingredients such as almonds, walnuts, peanuts, sesame seeds, and more.

Chaoshan Beef Balls: These can be divided into two types, Beef Balls and Beef Tendon Balls. Beef Balls are made from pure fresh meat, characterized by tender meat and a crispy texture. Beef Tendon Balls are made by adding tendons to the beef, resulting in a more fragrant taste, greater elasticity, and a crisp yet tender texture. Additionally, the tendon balls contain a burst of juice, releasing delicious flavors when chewed.

Pass Examination Porridge: Also known as Top Scholar Porridge, this is a very famous porridge in Guangdong. It is made with pork meatballs, pork intestines, pork liver, and other ingredients, cooked with ginger and scallions, resulting in a delicious flavor.

Char Siu Bao: The outer dough is soft and sweet, while the filling is made from char siu (barbecue pork). Char siu is one of the traditional roasted meats of Guangdong, renowned worldwide for its excellent color, fragrance, and taste.

Stir-fried Rice Noodles: Rice noodles, made from rice slurry that is steamed and then cut into strips, originated in the town of Shahe in Guangzhou, from which they get their name. Rice noodles can be stir-fried or served in soup, offering a variety of ways to enjoy them.

Boat Congee: Originating from Liwan District in Guangzhou, Guangdong Province. The ingredients for boat congee include raw fish slices, lean pork, shredded fried dough, peanuts, chopped scallions, shredded egg, pork rind, shredded jellyfish, shredded barbecued pork, shredded roasted duck, and squid, among others.
Double-Skin Milk: A delicious snack from Shunde District, Foshan City, Guangdong Province. It is made from fresh cow's milk and has a rich, creamy flavor.

1403028.caption: Could you please recommend some noodle delicacies in Anhui and provide the information in a text-and-image format?

Taihe Noodles: Originating from Taihe County in Fuyang City, Anhui Province, Taihe Noodles are deeply loved by the people of Anhui. The noodles are hand-pulled into wide strips, making them exceptionally chewy, and the taste is superb.

**Huaibei Scalded Noodles**: Scalded noodles are a specialty delicacy of Suzhou in Huaibei, Anhui. As the name suggests, these noodles are briefly scalded in boiling water before being taken out. They are very similar to rice noodles, exceptionally chewy, and are often enjoyed with vinegar and chili oil, making for an incredibly delicious taste.

Gela Tiao: Gela Tiao is a specialty of Fuyang. In the Fuyang dialect, the pronunciation for "stirring" is "Gela" (gé le), hence noodles that need to be stirred are called "Gela Tiao." Gela Tiao is very chewy. Mixed with sesame paste and paired with bean sprouts, it's stirred together before eating. The combination of salty, fragrant, and spicy flavors creates a unique taste experience.

Guoyang Dry Mixed Noodles: A heaping spoonful of chili is the essence of Guoyang Dry Mixed Noodles. People in the northern part of Anhui love to eat noodles. As long as they enjoy spicy food, they can eat a bowl of Guoyang Dry Mixed Noodles in the morning, at noon, or in the evening.

Huainan Beef Noodles: The beef is very tender and quite large in pieces; it does not feel dry at all when eaten. Adding a few spoonfuls of chili oil brings out a fragrant aroma and enhances the flavor significantly. The noodles are very fine and also very chewy.

Liu'an Pig Head Meat Noodles: A specialty noodle dish from the Liu'an region, renowned for its unique preparation process and taste, which has earned widespread acclaim. The distinction of this dish lies in its ingredient selection and production method. The pig head meat is first blanched, then simmered and stewed. After cooling, the meat is removed from the head and finally stir-fried with ginger and garlic in a hot pan with oil, resulting in a tender and smooth texture with a rich aroma. This method ensures that the pig head meat remains tender and the broth is rich and thick, aligning with the culinary habits of Liu'an residents.

Xiaodao Noodles: Xiaodao Noodles are purely handmade noodles. The noodles are repeatedly refined until they become translucent and delicate, with a chewy and springy texture. When combined with soul-warming crispy oil dregs, it is simply perfect—captures the nostalgic flavors of childhood.

Dangtu Pork Noodles: Originating from Dangtu County in Ma'anshan City, Anhui Province, this dish exudes a rich braised aroma when served. The large pieces of pork with alternating layers of fat and lean meat, combined with the chewy thick noodles, are not greasy at all.

1403087.caption: What traditional and unique foods in Zibo would you recommend? Please provide information in both text and images.

Dongpo Elbow (Dongpo Pork Elbow)

Dongpo Elbow is a traditional famous dish from Zibo, cherished for its rich yet not greasy, soft but appropriately chewy texture. The preparation process of this dish is highly intricate, requiring prolonged simmering and meticulous seasoning to achieve the delectable taste of Dongpo Elbow.

Burst Shrimp Balls

Burst Shrimp Balls are one of the specialty dishes of Zibo. They are loved for their savory sauce flavor and tender shrimp balls. This dish uses fresh large shrimp, which are processed and fried, then stir-fried with a specially made sauce. The outer layer of the Burst Shrimp Balls is crispy, while the inside is tender and juicy, offering a rich texture. It is one of the most beloved foods among the people of Zibo.

Grilled Meat Mixed Rice

Grilled meat mixed rice is one of the traditional famous dishes of Zibo, highly praised for its crispy grilled meat and abundant ingredients. The dish uses tender pork, grilled over charcoal, then mixed with rice and various vegetables and seasonings. The texture of the grilled meat mixed rice is rich, and its aroma is irresistible, making it one of the beloved delicacies of the people of Zibo.

Grilled Lamb Skewers

Grilled lamb skewers are one of the traditional specialty foods of Zibo, highly praised for their spicy seasoning and unique barbecue flavor. This delicacy is made using high-quality lamb, combined with specially made seasonings and spices, and grilled on skewers. The lamb skewers are tender and juicy, with an enticing aroma, and their distinctive barbecue flavor makes them one of the most beloved delicacies in the Zibo area.

1403033.caption: What local delicacies are recommended when traveling to Fenghuang Ancient Town? Please provide detailed information with images and text.

Savor Phoenix Paper-Wrapped Fish, Average Price Per Person: 44 RMB. Just look at the pictures to see, the portion is incredibly generous, the fish is well-seasoned with a bit of spiciness, it tastes very flavorful. The dishes are served quickly, and the environment is pleasant.

Green Tea, Average Cost per Person: 16 yuan. It seems to be the Xiangxi version of Chayan, and the taste is quite good. The tea flavor is relatively strong, and the cream is slightly sweet. I like its cup sleeve, which has a phoenix label, making it suitable for taking photos. Overall, it's pretty good.

Cui Cui Miao Pancake, 12 Yuan per person: Before coming to Fenghuang, I did some research and saw that many people recommended this place. I bought a classic version, which includes tofu skin and fried egg, with an additional unknown sauce. It tastes quite fragrant, and is definitely something you’d want to eat again after trying!

Golden Leaf Noodle Shop, Average Cost per Person: 16 RMB: This is a noodle shop frequented by local residents of Fenghuang. The taste is authentic, and the portions are generous. Their specialty, the Fenghuang-style mung bean noodles, is very delicious and something you won't find elsewhere.

Black Classic Stinky Tofu, Average Cost per Person: 11 Yuan. Stinky Tofu is a standard dish in Hunan. The sauce covers the stinky tofu, making it exceptionally fragrant! It tastes just like the Black Classic in Changsha. I bought the large portion; it's delicious and affordable.

Ma Ge Food Stall, Average Cost per Person: 50 Yuan: Loved by local friends in Fenghuang, it truly did not disappoint us. The garlic eggplant is particularly delicious and a must-order! Both the vegetables and meats are quite fresh and plump. The stir-fried egg and noodles, which we blindly ordered from the owner, turned out to be particularly tasty as well. You must try this!

Drunken Wander in Western Hunan, Average Cost per Person: 71 yuan. The restaurant is quite spacious, and the blood rice duck is delicious. If you can't tolerate very spicy food, you can inform the staff. The place is clean and hygienic, and the staff have a very good service attitude.

Stuffed Shrimp Cakes, Average Price per Person: 9 RMB. The location is slightly difficult to find, it's by the ancient city's river. The shrimp are live and very fresh. They taste incredibly good when eaten hot, crispy, you could easily eat two in one go.

1403062.caption: What are some recommended traditional specialty foods in Qinhuangdao? Please share with me through text and pictures.

Four Strips Bun: These buns are five yuan for three. The skin is very glutinous and seems different from what I have had elsewhere. While they aren't particularly stunning, they are not bad and worth trying. 

Address: The shop is named Four Strips Bun and is located on Gucheng Street. The detailed address is the middle section of Gucheng Street, at the intersection of Dong San Tiao and Nan Dajie.

Fried Mung Bean Jelly: This mung bean jelly dish is very affordable at eight yuan per serving. There are many vendors selling fried mung bean jelly on this snack street, but many people highly recommend this particular vendor. The mung bean jelly is soft, and the sesame paste is slightly salty. It tastes both spicy and salty, but the flavor is quite good. For those who prefer a lighter taste, you can ask the owner to use less seasoning. 

Address: The shop is called Yan Sister's Mung Bean Jelly and Egg Pancake Roll. It is located next to Gate 4 of the Leduhui Shopping Center in Qinhuangdao.

Green Dragon Old Tofu: The tofu product here is very good to ladies, and the portion size of this old tofu is very ample—a large bowl full to the brim. At the end, the owner even gave a little extra. Address: The name of this store is Green Dragon Old Tofu, located 120 meters northeast of the intersection of Provincial Highway 261 and Township Road 080.

Pink Pigeon: It is a round, somewhat thin pancake that is crispy and has a very attractive color. I bought some pigeons from the west gate, and they seemed quite delicious.

Address: This shop is called Kaida Dumpling City, located at No. 319 Hongqi Road, Kaida Dumpling City.

1403011.caption: What local delicacies are recommended in Handan, Hebei? Please provide details in both text and images.

Pan-fried blood sausage and pan-fried Guan Zhang: These are local specialty foods. The blood sausage is made from pig's blood, while the Guan Zhang is made from buckwheat flour. They are very delicious!!! Moreover, as local specialties, they are worth trying!

Pan-fried Blood, Pan-fried Skin Residue: Local delicacies! The blood is from pig's blood, and the skin residue is made from vermicelli (unfortunately, no picture available). Among these, I find the pan-fried blood to be the most delicious! It somewhat resembles stinky tofu and comes highly recommended! Definitely worth a try!

Old Beijing Braised Dish: One bowl costs 25 yuan, the portion is very large, and it includes various ingredients such as pork intestines, beef, baked buns, and dried tofu. It is recommended for multiple people to share one portion; it can completely serve as dinner.

Xuebuqiao Tofu Soup: A locally popular restaurant named "Xuebuqiao Tofu Soup." The tofu is very tender, and it seems to be stewed with a different broth, making it worth a try! Even better than their tofu soup are their egg pancakes!!! They are incredibly delicious!!! The pancake is brushed with a fantastic sweet sauce, and it's very affordable, offering excellent value for money!!!!
Jasmine Iced Soy Milk: Jasmine flowers + iced soy milk, delicious and worth a try!

No. 25 Spicy Hot Pot: A highly popular local restaurant that is so crowded, it's hard to get in! It’s somewhat similar to oden; you pick your own ingredients after they’ve been cooked, pour on some sesame sauce, and then add your own seasonings. However, I personally added too much chili and I’m not good with spicy food, so my recommendation rating is not high. But for those who love spicy food, go for it!!!! Their braised chicken feet are worth a try!

Snowflake Pudding: It consists of sweet syrup topped with fresh milk mochi. The syrup is cold while the mochi is hot, so the combination feels a bit strange. The mochi itself is average, but overall it's not bad. It's fairly common and worth a try.
Iced Tangyuan: Sweet syrup + glutinous rice balls! Very delicious, with a wide variety and generous portions, but it's commonly available and not a local specialty. Worth a try.
Fried tofu: The tofu is very tender, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. However, it is commonly seen everywhere, so it can be tried or not.

1403057.caption: What are some recommended eateries in Ji'an for travelers? Please provide the information in both text and pictures.

Lao San's Private Kitchen
Average cost per person: ￥55
Stir-Fried Beef with Bean Sprouts
Brown Sugar Rice Cakes
Fried Dumplings
Shredded Potatoes

Generous portions at a reasonable price. Great to come with more people to try more dishes, very delicious!!

Book Street Fried Dough Stick
Average Cost per Person: ¥16.5

Items:
- Pork and Egg Soup Noodles
- Stir-Fried Rice Noodles
- Iced Soy Milk
- Fried Dough Stick
- Spring Rolls

The spring rolls here are completely different from the thick ones we have in Guangdong; these are lighter, thinner, and crisper! They are very delicious, and I love them very much!

Lu Ling Ji Tea
Average Price: ￥10
Meng Lu Ling
Avocado Mango Drink

Local milk tea, give it a try! Affordable and inexpensive, the Meng Lu Ling with 30% sugar I ordered was just right to balance the richness.

Book Street Barbecue, Average Cost ￥30 per Person

The value for money is not high, but the taste is acceptable.
Li Ji Beef Noodles ¥12.5 Small Serving of Beef Noodles + Braised Egg
Zhou Zhenzhen's Nanchang Mixed Rice Noodles ¥8

Glasses Skewers: Average cost per person ￥35. Ordered a table full and spent only 70 yuan, paying by counting the skewers. The dipping sauce is made by the owner and has fragrant crushed peanuts. Cheap and delicious.
Zhangshu Lao Clear Soup ¥11 per person Large portion of clear soup + 2 spring rolls It's like wonton! But it is made with thinner skin and a bit of pork.

1403091.caption: What unique and notable foods would you recommend in Nanyang? Please provide information in both text and images.

Dengzhou Wozi Noodles

Wozi Noodles originally came from Wuhan Hot Dry Noodles. After Wuhan Hot Dry Noodles were introduced to Dengzhou in Henan Province, they were improved by adding mung bean sprouts, diced beef, and drizzling beef fat chili oil, making them exceptionally fragrant and spicy. The flavor reached new heights, and the dish was renamed Wozi Noodles.

The main regions where Wozi Noodles are popular include Xiangyang in Hubei province, Dengzhou in Henan province, Xinye in Henan province, and the Nanyang triangular region. Wozi Noodle shops in these areas are increasingly thriving. Wozi Noodles are not only one of the locals' breakfast staples but also a famous snack in Dengzhou, Henan. 

The characteristics of this dish include a soft texture of the noodles, a fragrant and smooth taste of the fresh broth, rich ingredients, and tender meat, making it hard to stop eating! The taste is somewhat similar to Hot Dry Noodles but has a chewier texture. Moreover, it is reasonably priced and very affordable.

Xixia Dried Tofu

Xixia Dried Tofu is one of the traditional delicacies of Xixia County in Nanyang City. It is made from high-quality local soybeans and goes through multiple processes such as soaking, grinding, and filtering. The unique aspect of this dish lies in the perfect balance between its firmness and texture, along with its fragrant, salty, and mildly spicy flavor. Xixia Dried Tofu is rich in nutrients, easy to digest, and has various health benefits, such as lowering blood lipids and protecting cardiovascular health. It is a delicious and healthy food.

Sheqi Duck Neck

Sheqi Duck Neck is one of the traditional snacks of Sheqi County in Nanyang City. It is renowned for its crispy exterior and spicy, flavorful taste. This delicacy is made using high-quality local ducks, with the duck meat cut into small pieces, marinated in specially made spices and chili peppers, and then roasted. The result is a snack that is crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and has an irresistible aroma, making it hard to stop eating.

Zhangjiajie Oil Cake

Zhangjiajie Oil Cake is a traditional sweet snack from Nanyang City, originating in Nanyang County near Zhangjiajie. Its main ingredient is glutinous rice, which undergoes soaking, grinding into paste, and fermentation processes to make. Zhangjiajie Oil Cake is characterized by its fragrant and delicious taste, with a crispy exterior and a tender interior. It is also rich in nutrients and is deeply loved by both locals and tourists.

1403065.caption: What are the traditional specialty foods of Zaozhuang? Please share some with me in both text and images.

Zaozhuang Spicy Chicken: It is said that Zaozhuang Spicy Chicken is a specialty here. This restaurant is very popular, and its interior decoration is unique. This spicy chicken is different from the Sichuan type as it comes with sauce. The chicken used is a rooster, with firm and not dry meat. A single serving contains a whole chicken, which is not very friendly for a small number of people. It would be nice if they could offer a half-serving. It is extremely delicious. 

Address:
The name of this restaurant is Mingli Spicy Chicken. Its detailed address is 50 meters east of the intersection of Guangming West Road and Nanxichang South Road, on the south side of the road.

Zaozhuang Vegetable Pancake: This is just an unremarkable small shop on the street, yet its business is extremely good. One pancake is very large, and even with ample toppings, it only costs about ten yuan, enough for two people to eat. Moreover, it is very filling, with both vegetables and meat, making it very substantial.

Address: The name of the shop is "Jia Erjie Vegetable Pancake," and its detailed address is opposite Xiguan Third Street on Xingzhong Road.

Huanghua Beef Noodles: The noodles are very chewy and paired excellently with daylily. The chili peppers are aromatic and spicy, so it's advisable for those who cannot handle spice to use them sparingly. The small beef chunks are very delicious. Overall, it tends to be slightly salty, but the flavor is good.

Address: The name of the shop is Master Song’s Huanghua Beef Noodles. Its detailed address is 100 meters north of the intersection of Linyun Road and Jinguang Road, on the east side.

Tengzhou Spicy Soup: Spicy soup is very cheap, only 3 yuan, and the portion is very generous. It contains bean curd skin, shredded kelp, peanuts, cilantro, and black pepper. It tastes quite good. Address: The name of the shop is Laoteng County. Zhongjia Night Spicy Soup. The detailed address is 57 Longtou Middle Road.

1403079.caption: What traditional and distinctive foods from Beijing would you recommend? Please provide a description with images.

Douzhi: Hmm... I believe it needs no introduction; everyone is already familiar with its taste. By all means, do not be curious about how bad it tastes. [Shy] [Shy] Of course, to make the most of your trip to Beijing, trying Douzhi is also an option. Address: This shop is located at 295 Andingmen Inner Street.

Peking Duck: Speaking of Peking Duck, everyone must be very familiar with its crispy skin. This one is not greasy at all; wrapped in a pancake with scallions and cucumber, it is incredibly delicious and fragrant. Address: Floor 1, F104, Floor 2, F203, Xinhuo Building, 7 East Damochang Street.

Candied Hawthorn: He Fulu's candied hawthorn is very famous. It is warm when you bite into it and extremely satisfying. The sugar does not stick to your teeth at all, and the consistency of the hawthorn is excellent. The texture is very smooth, and the balance of sweet and sour is just right.

Donkey Rolling: Soft, sticky, and sweet—truly delicious. Moreover, it has a sweet but not greasy taste, which is highly favored by red bean paste enthusiasts.

Address: Lao Hui Hui Snacks (Baiwanzhuang Branch)
First Floor, No. 9 Baiwanzhuang North Street

1403073.caption: Could you recommend any seafood restaurants for traveling to Zhoushan, and please provide the information in both text and images?

Authentic Flavors: Putuoshan Blessings Return Trip Local Seafood Restaurant

The meat of the miscellaneous sea fish is tender and fresh. You can also try their pan-seared dragonhead fish and baked vermicelli with seafood, which are richly flavored and absolutely delightful when eaten hot!

Shan Xian Zhoushan Seafood Noodles: A favorite noodle shop among locals. The rice noodles absorb the broth well, and you can choose your own toppings. Personally, I recommend the swimming crab and the signature noodles, which highlight the fresh sweetness of the seafood. The broth is rich and flavorful, leaving you feeling thoroughly satisfied after a bowl.

Golden Bay Seafood Stall: A long-standing favorite in Zhujiajian, known for its generous portions of boiled white shrimp and salt and pepper tofu fish. The seafood fried rice cakes here are truly exceptional—soft, flavorful, and best enjoyed while hot. My friend loves the tofu fish; the fish meat is incredibly tender!

Little Glutton Seafood Stall: Located near Dongsha, we happened to go at a lucky time and there was no line. The swimming crabs and mantis shrimp here are fresh and generously portioned. The stir-fried squid is tender and chewy—a single person could easily finish an entire plate.

Acheng Seafood: The business is quite booming, located near the pier. They offer a wide variety of seafood, including freshly prepared clams and black sea bream with succulent meat. The owner even asks if customers can handle spicy food and tailors the dishes accordingly. The service is truly impeccable.

Gaojia Zhuang Seafood Restaurant: A well-known place in Putuo Mountain, with an elegant environment. The Zhoushan hairtail fish is plump and tender, every piece of fish is soaked in rich, red sauce, and the yogurt is also very delicious.

1403089.caption: What are some famous foods in Zhengzhou that you would recommend? Please provide the information in text and images.

Tofu Pudding

Tofu pudding is one of Zhengzhou's traditional delicacies, highly esteemed for its unique cooking techniques and delicious taste. This dish uses soy milk as its main ingredient, adding various seasonings and fillings (such as minced meat, shiitake mushrooms, etc.). It is formed through coagulation, resulting in a smooth and tender texture.

Roast Lamb Leg

Roast lamb leg is one of Zhengzhou's traditional barbecue dishes, beloved for its crispy exterior and tender meat. This delicacy is primarily made from lamb leg, which is roasted with a variety of seasonings and spices, resulting in a fragrant and delicious taste.

Sugar Oil Cakes

Sugar oil cakes are one of Zhengzhou's traditional snacks, loved for their crispy outer layer and sweet filling. This delicacy primarily uses glutinous rice flour as the main ingredient, with the addition of sugar, oil, and other seasonings. After being deep-fried, the snack boasts a crispy texture and a sweet filling.

Zhengzhou Yellow River Carp

One of Zhengzhou’s famous local dishes is the Yellow River Carp. The carp from the Yellow River has a plump body, tender and delicious flesh, and is rich in nutrients with a long history. The Yellow River Carp is not only unique in flavor but also highly nourishing, making it one of Henan's specialty foods.

1403021.caption: What are some recommended delicacies in Datong, Shanxi? Please provide the information in both text and images.

Datong Ancient City Long Juxiang, Average Price per Person: 80

Shumai comes in various flavors, different from Cantonese shumai, it resembles soup dumplings and is very suitable for breakfast. The traditional sweet and sour pork is truly exceptional, with a strong vinegar aroma. The dried daylilies from Shanxi are consistently excellent and are very tasty when stir-fried fresh. The oat cheese stuffed eggplant is a must-order for dessert lovers!

Datong Ancient City 369 Whole Grain Restaurant, Average Price: 80 RMB per person

Despite the name "Whole Grain," it offers more than just various carbohydrates. The pork knuckle with pancakes is particularly fragrant. Eggplant enthusiasts must try the signature eggplant dish. The Yanggao flour dumplings are chewy and become even more enjoyable to eat when cooled. The oil-splashed oat noodles are a must-try specialty.

Ancient City of Datong, Yunzhong Twelve Alleys, average cost per person 30: The first meal in Datong, a bowl of sliced noodles warms the stomach. Cold jelly, cold cake, deep-fried meat, lamb offal—I personally think the dishes from these places are all very delicious.

Inside Wutai Mountain, there is a vegetarian Dico's with an average cost of 40 yuan per person. Everything is vegetarian, but it is made to resemble meat. It is said that they use soy products for preparation. The burgers and chicken nuggets there are especially delicious! The chicken nuggets are particularly chewy; highly recommended!!

Not in Datong, but outside the Hukou Waterfall Scenic Area. The average cost per person is 100 RMB. The Yellow River carp should definitely be eaten outside the scenic area; it is fresh and delicious. The chicken eggs with local vegetables have a particularly rich egg flavor. As for the shaved potatoes, I personally find the taste to be quite strong, perhaps because the shop made it too salty.

By the ancient city of Datong, next to Huayan Temple, there is a restaurant called Xijindao Knife-Cut Noodles with an average price of 35 RMB per person. In my opinion, this is the best noodle house in terms of environment and flavor. Although Shanxi's knife-cut noodles are delicious at every restaurant, the taste varies. This particular restaurant's flavor is most suitable for the general palate. They also offer a wide variety of side dishes; I highly recommend the braised meat strips!!

He Shengcai Sea Buckthorn Shop: You can come here to buy souvenirs. As for the sea buckthorn bread, you must try it when you come to Datong! They are everywhere by the roadside, so you can grab any without worrying about the brand!

The Old Bean Noodle House by Grandma Liu 003

Average Cost per Person: 20 yuan

Specialty: Bean Noodles with a Rich Broth. This is an old, well-established noodle shop. One bowl of noodles, a side dish, and a few skewers of lamb—extremely flavorful. (For the side dish, be sure to add chili peppers and pour vinegar over it; this is how the locals eat it.)

1403080.caption: What are some special delicacies in Rizhao, Shandong? Please share with me in text and images.

Xi Shi Tongue: Many people recommend it. When its shell is opened, the white flesh that comes out resembles a small tongue, hence it is called "Xi Shi Tongue." It is very plump and delicious, but some people are put off by its appearance...

Location: There are many shops in Rizhao specializing in making this dish. Chocolate Fisherman is highly recommended by many, but due to its popularity, there is often a queue.

Rizhao Pancake: It is indeed quite delicious. The pancake batter is mixed exceptionally well. The pancake is very crispy, but it has a certain thickness and even if you leave it for a few more minutes, it still maintains that level of quality. 

Address: This pancake shop is located in the alley between Yin Zhi Community and Shizhi District No. 1. It may be a bit difficult to find.

Sunlight Large Bamboo Clams: Those who have watched seashore foraging videos should know that these are a very precious type of shellfish seafood that can supplement protein. Address: Blue Sea Grand Hotel

Seawater Cicada: crispy and delicious, it crunches when you chew it. Its shell looks very hard, but actually it is not. It is very tasty when deep-fried. 

Address: 140 meters northeast of the intersection of Huang Hai Third Road and Haibin First Road, known as Zhonghui Fishing Village.

1403031.caption: What local delicacies do you recommend for a trip to Zhuzhou? Please provide the information in both text and images.

Jumping Frog Loves Chicken (Hejiatu Cultural Park Main Store): The Jumping Frog, which has been operating for many years, has an impeccable taste. You can add extra ingredients and cook them together; the longer it cooks, the richer and spicier the flavor becomes. For those who can't handle spicy food, it is recommended to order it mildly spicy.

Zhijiu Cottage: There are two stores in Zhuzhou. One is located in Hejiatu, which has been open for a longer time but is smaller in size. The other is on Tianlun Road in Hexi, with more refined décor and a larger space. Their mango series is highly recommended, as well as the milk peach gum rice balls, double-skin milk, and grass jelly.

MANGYDOG Laipi Dog Gourmet Hot Dogs: This new store just opened two months ago on Qiyi Road. In addition to gourmet hot dogs, the store also offers burgers and snacks. It has a high cost-performance ratio and uses good-quality ingredients. The buns are freshly baked by the owner every day.

Kuyi BBQ (Wanda Plaza Branch): My favorite Korean BBQ restaurant in the entire city of Zhuzhou! They offer a wide variety of side dishes, with unlimited refills. The meat is fresh, tender, and juicy, paired with their special sauces, making for a rich and flavorful dining experience.

Wenji Shrimp One Jump (Main Store): This main store in Hexi has become more comfortable after last year's renovation. Their pressure-cooked oysters are very large and delicious. As for the spicy crayfish, it might be that my taste preference is on the heavier side, I feel they are not flavorful enough.

Old Northeast Pie King (Hejiatu Branch): The pies are best enjoyed hot. Recommended dishes include pies, dumplings, mixed salad, and sweet and sour pork. Although this is a small restaurant, the taste is indeed impeccable.

1403017.caption: What unique local delicacies would you recommend in Shangqiu, Hunan? Please provide the information in both text and images."
Guide Fat Sister's Candied Hawthorn: Fresh ingredients, affordable prices.
Ancient Town Small Fish Soup: The soup is delicious and flavorful, with many small fish in it. Adding vinegar makes it even better.
Red Braised Pork with White Rice Paper: The boss generously adds meat without hesitation, paired with green peppers to cut the grease ~ but eating too much can be a bit overwhelming!
Old Ma's gluten skewers: Cost-performance king, good taste.
Imperial Almond Tea: Freshly made lotus seed soup, rich in ingredients. A cup in the winter warms both the heart and the stomach.

1403066.caption: What are the recommended local delicacies in Baoding? Please provide the information in both text and images.

Baoding Donkey Meat Sandwich: Donkey meat sandwich has been our long-time favorite. This sandwich doesn't contain chili, and it has a generous amount of meat. Each sandwich costs 13 yuan and they are very delicious. The seasoning is just right. The tofu soup and tomato soup are also extremely tasty. Overall, we are quite satisfied. The name of the shop is Liuhe Ren Donkey Meat Shop, and it is located in Ansu Town.

Beef Soaked Pancake: "Soaked pancake" means tearing the fried pancake into pieces and soaking them in beef broth. The beef they use is of high-quality beef shank, sliced thinly. You can choose the amount of pancake and beef yourself. It feels quite good, right?  
Address: The name of the store is Zhi Li An Jia Soaked Pancake, and the detailed address is 199 Tian'e West Road, at the ground-level commercial shops on the north side of the International Club.

Bai Yunzhang's Steamed Buns: I feel that the skin of these buns is the same as ordinary buns, but the filling is what makes them different from typical beef or lamb buns. The filling is smoother and more flavorful. Additionally, coupled with their unique peach-scented vinegar, the satisfaction is overwhelming. 

Address: The name of the shop is Bai Yunzhang, and the detailed address is beside the North Gate of Baoding Mall on Market Street.

Gaobeidian Tofu Strips: These tofu strips come in small, individual packages and offer many different flavors to choose from. Personally, I find the black bean tofu strips to be the tastiest, although the soybean ones are also quite good. The prices are very affordable.

Address: The name of this store is "Lao Tan Jingshun Tofu Strips." The detailed address is No. 224 Xingfu North Street.

1403049.caption: What delicious foods are recommended in Sanya? Please provide me with the information in a text-and-picture format.

Fermented Residue Vinegar Hot Pot: Let me tell you, even as someone who normally doesn't eat sour food, I could enjoy it! The flavor is quite good, and I ate it with great satisfaction! It's sour and spicy, not as peculiar as coconut chicken. Especially when paired with the local lantern chili (small sauce), the more you eat, the more addictive it becomes. When seafood is added, it is also very appetizing. The first place I tried it was at Lao He’s Hainanese Noodles & Fermented Residue Vinegar Seafood Hot Pot, which is mainly known for its Hainanese noodles, but the hot pot comes as a close second. The second place was at the Atlantis Water Park, where I had it served in a bowl, and the taste was also good—definitely not a disappointment!

Authentic Coconut Milk Qingbuliang: To be honest, it's worth trying wherever you go! Generally no disappointments, it’s refreshing and cooling, with plenty of fruits and ingredients inside, not overly sweet. However, the best I've ever had was delivered from a takeaway! Qingbuliang served in a coconut and coconut jelly — although similar to the various ingredients found in milk tea shops in Shanghai, it's just tastier. So much so that when I returned to Shanghai, I ordered it many times, but it was never as delicious as it was in Hainan.

Coconut Chicken Hotpot: Mainly, I can't get used to this type of sweet hotpot; it's too bland. Although the chicken is very tender, my stomach can't handle it. I would advise against trying it if you can't get accustomed to very mild flavors. However!! Their rice dumplings are really delicious, very fragrant and sticky, with a strong salted meat flavor!

Night Market Small Seafood: The spicy stir-fried dishes taste quite good! The ingredients are very fresh, and the prices are uniform. I recommend medium spiciness! At Yiheng Night Market, Zhe-Sis Seafood Hotpot is recommended because I was afraid of choosing the wrong place, so I ate there twice. They offer small seafood such as crabs, shrimps, mantis shrimps, clams, etc. This night market has really delicious watermelon juice!

1403025.caption: What are the recommended Northeastern Chinese dishes in Dalian? Please provide details in text and images.

Snow Coat Red Bean Paste: One serving contains 8 pieces, with red bean paste wrapped in egg white. This red bean paste is homemade, featuring obvious red bean granules and a moderate sweetness. The egg white does not have a fishy taste, and it is much tastier than the ones I had in Tianjin. It must be said that you have to eat it in Northeast China.

Dry-Fried Small-Billed Fish: This fish is quite delicious. It is first deep-fried and then topped with a sauce. It has a sweet and sour taste but is not overly sweet, with a hint of fish fragrance. Moreover, it is reasonably priced and comes in a particularly large portion. Highly recommended!
Sour Soup with Fatty Beef: This one is rather ordinary, the spiciness is quite pronounced, and the texture of the fatty beef is not very good. Be cautious in ordering this.

Three-Treasure Mung Bean Jelly: This dish is made with mung bean flour jelly, topped with sauce. Its taste is similar to that found in Tianjin, but with the addition of some seafood stock and a reduced proportion of sesame paste in the sauce. I do not like eating mung bean jelly, so I won't comment further.

Guobaorou (Sweet and Sour Pork): Highly recommended! The best Guobaorou is in the three northeastern provinces. It is fried to a crispy perfection, with tenderloin slices cut relatively thin. The sauce is not overly sweet or greasy, perfectly coating the tenderloin. Even after a while, it does not become soggy.

Seaweed Steamed Dumplings: They have the same taste as chive buns. It seems like they are made with dumpling wrappers, but they are steamed in a steamer. The wrapper is quite sticky. Inside, there is a whole sea cucumber, but I didn't eat the remaining part, so I don't have much of an opinion.

1403018.caption: What are some recommended specialty dishes from Anyang? Please provide them in both text and images.

Anyang Huimian: The broth is incredibly, incredibly fresh! It includes a variety of ingredients: cabbage, tofu, meatballs, crispy fried meat, black fungus, wide noodles... Suitable for the elderly and children.

Hometown Steamed Bowl Set: A selection of six types of steamed dishes, including small crispy pork, meatballs, fermented bean curd pork, eight-treasure rice... all are meat-based, with large portions suitable for sampling each variety.

Blood Cake with Shrimp: Buckwheat noodles mixed with a little pig's blood, resulting in a crispy, fragrant exterior and a sticky inside, without any hint of a bloody taste. The large shrimp are fried to a very tender state, allowing you to eat them directly with the shrimp shells.
San Bu Zhan: Soft and sticky, melts in your mouth. It is topped with osmanthus honey and hawthorn jelly, making it an ideal dessert after a meal.
Steamed Vegetable Rolls: One portion includes 8 pieces, filled primarily with chives, eggs, and vermicelli. The dough is very thin and chewy.
Fermented Bean Jelly: It is a mung bean-based dish similar to cold jelly, mixed with sesame paste and cucumber. It is tangy, sweet, and very refreshing and appetizing.

1403078.caption: What are some authentic Xi'an specialty foods you would recommend? Please provide details with pictures and text.

Roujiamo: The Roujiamo from this place in Xi’an is very famous. The bread is baked to be quite resilient, and the combination of the savory flavor of the meat and the elasticity of the bread is excellent. 

Address: 46 Fenchang, South Street, Beilin District, Hongzhaoxuan Biangbiang Noodles and Roujiamo.

Oil-Splashed Biang Biang Noodles: Biang Biang noodles from Xi'an are also very famous. The noodles come in a large bowl and are very chewy and smooth with an authentic and spicy flavor. The texture is excellent; although it is just a bowl of oil-splashed noodles, it provides a unique taste experience. Additionally, the service is also excellent. 

Address: The same as the one for the meat sandwich mentioned above.

Lamb Soup Stew: The taste is very authentic, with a rich broth and well-cooked ingredients. The side dishes are also quite good and very fresh. Locals also say it is very authentic.
Address: 01-02, Area A, Qihang Jiayuan, Fengdong New City, Xixian Road, Sanqiao Street, Weiyang District.

Xi'an Saozi Noodles: This place offers very affordable noodles, with a bowl costing just 5 yuan. The portion is not large. The signature Saozi Noodles are a specialty here, and the taste is very delicious. Address: Located at No. 7 Zhangba North Road, Gaoxin District, Nanfeng Building, the third shop from south to north.

1403053.caption: What are some specialty foods in Fujian? Please provide your recommendations with pictures and descriptions.
Five-Spice Rolls: They are made by wrapping meat in bean curd sheets, then deep-frying it. The outer layer is crispy, while the meat inside is quite savory and aromatic.

Eight Treasures Fried Cake: It primarily includes crab meat, crab roe, crispy peanut slices, and diced fish. These are fried until they form a gelatinous texture, but it can feel a bit greasy when eaten.

Oyster Tofu Soup: The soups in Pingtan generally have a slightly sour taste, so those who do not like sour flavors might mind. However, this type of sourness has a unique taste that everyone can try a little bit of.

Eel Rice: This is a traditional famous dish from Fuzhou, Fujian. It mainly uses glutinous rice and ingredients such as red eel, duck gizzards, ham, dried shrimp, and shiitake mushrooms, all steamed together. This effectively infuses the aroma of the eel into the rice.

1403038.caption: What are some recommended foods in the ancient city of Lijiang, Fujian? Please provide the information in text and image form.

Apoqing Smoked Pork Ribs Hotpot: I saw many people lining up, so I decided to follow the crowd and choose this place! The result was unexpectedly delicious. I later learned that this restaurant was featured on "A Bite of China." No wonder the broth is so authentic. Even though I don't usually drink soup, I ended up having several bowls.

Brother Jiu's Pigpen Coffee: Located right opposite Brother Jiu's Rice Noodles. After enjoying the rice noodles, you can come over for a cup of coffee. The café has two floors, and the design is fantastic. Which girl can resist taking 200 beautiful photos before leaving? Friends can sit, chat leisurely, and enjoy the scenery all afternoon; it’s so chill and comfortable.

Jiu Ge Rice Noodles: The decor is very appealing! The entire store is surrounded by small streams and fresh flowers. The rice noodles not only look great but also taste authentic. The flavors live up to the wall full of honors. I chose a window seat, which offers a wide view and great scenery! It's perfect for both taking photos and enjoying delicious food.

Lion's Hill Night Market: A wide variety of delicious snacks and street food! While the shops in the old town start to close around 10 PM, this place remains open, catering to night owls seeking enjoyment. Grilled oysters, barbecues, milk tea, spicy chicken stew, sweet soups, fruit bowls, crayfish, and more. I spent 50 RMB and tried everything from start to finish!
7seabar Cafe: The terrace is a popular spot for social media check-ins, offering a view of Jade Dragon Snow Mountain. You may need to queue, but it is worth it.
Chizi Coffee: Located in Yuhu Village at the foot of Jade Dragon Snow Mountain, this place lacks a strong commercial atmosphere. It's a great spot to stroll around.

1403043.caption: What are some recommended dishes in Yibin, Sichuan? Please provide the information with images and text.

Yibin Ran Mian: Yibin Ran Mian is one of the most iconic delicacies of Yibin, known for its unique flavor and distinctive preparation techniques. It features firm and well-drained noodles, crushed roasted peanuts, Yibin preserved vegetable sprouts, chopped green onions, and irresistibly addictive secret chili oil. With a combination of spiciness and numbing sensation, the noodles are loose, red, and glossy, with an aroma that is irresistible, leaving a lingering taste on the lips and teeth after the first bite.

Leaf Dumplings: A traditional snack made from glutinous rice and fresh meat with vegetable stuffing, known for its delicious taste. The sweet version is also tasty, with fillings such as black sesame and peanuts or red bean paste.

Junlian Rice Noodles: A type of noodle dish popular among the people of Yibin. It can be served as vegetarian rice noodles, hot pot rice noodles, or rice noodles with pork intestines. The texture is smooth and tender, the broth delicious, and the variety of seasonings offer a balanced mix of sour and spicy flavors. After eating, one might break into a slight sweat, leaving them wanting more.
Lizhuang White Meat: Selected cuts of specific parts of pork are meticulously prepared, resulting in meat with an ideal balance of fat and lean, offering a delicate texture.

Shuanghe Lianggao (Cold Cake): Since the people of Shuanghe prefer to use the water from Grape Well to make Lianggao, Shuanghe Lianggao has garnered a unique and distinctive reputation as "Grape Well Cold Cake." The texture of the cold cake is smooth and refreshing, offering a cool sensation upon consumption, with a chewy, tender, and delicious taste.

Gaoxian Traditional Hotpot: Gaoxian Traditional Hotpot is a traditional delicacy from Gaoxian, Yibin. The hotpot includes a rich variety of ingredients, such as pork trotters and native chicken among the meat options, as well as kelp, taro, and wood ear mushrooms among the vegetarian options. During the cooking process, the ingredients fully absorb the richness and umami of the broth, resulting in a deep and flavorful taste.

Junlian Spicy Numbing Chicken: With a history of over 100 years, this dish is known for its meticulous ingredient selection and exquisite preparation. The best choice is the Ayam Cemani chicken weighing around 1500 grams, which is cooked with a secret ancestral blend of seasonings. It boasts a unique flavor, firm texture, and excellent taste.

Yibin Silver Thread Roll: Silver Thread Roll, also known as Bird's Nest Silk, is another specialty snack from Yibin. It has a stringy texture when eaten. It contains lard and sugar, giving it a fragrant and sweet taste.

Nanxi Dried Tofu: Nanxi dried tofu is renowned for its unique production process and taste. After multiple rounds of marinating and baking, the dried tofu becomes tender, fragrant, and golden in color. There is a wide variety of Nanxi dried tofu, including five-spice flavor, spicy flavor, chicken broth flavor, among others.

1403012.caption: What are the local delicacies recommended by residents of Shijiazhuang? Please provide information with both text and images.
Red Star Buns: Located next to the Hebei Museum, this bun shop has a history of over 50 years and enjoys high popularity in Shijiazhuang.
Liang Yi Li Ji Beef Soup and Noodles: Water Pavilion Hua Du Shop (Minjiang Branch). The bowls are very large! The soup inside is very delicious! By the way, their roasted beef bones are very tasty.
Niuchunhua Banmian (Wanda Store): Intersection of Hualing Road and Jianhua Street. One of the best Anhui-style beef noodles in Shijiazhuang. The taste is very authentic.
The Scholar Cao's Pancakes (Tianshan Garden Branch): Located at the entrance of Tianshan Garden Community, I've been eating here since high school! Every pancake inside is delicious!

1403095.caption: What are some recommended delicacies in Xinyang? Please provide the information in both text and images.

Xinyang Gushi Goose Pieces

Xinyang Gushi Goose Pieces is a distinctive local dish made from geese originally produced in Gushi County, Henan Province. The dish undergoes a special cooking process, resulting in a flavor that tends toward spiciness, with a bright and enticing soup and tender meat.

Xinyang Stone Jelly

Xinyang Stone Jelly is one of the signature delicacies of Xinyang City. It is a refreshing and cooling food, highly effective in quenching thirst and relieving summer heat. Stone Jelly is very popular and suitable for all ages. It is not only distinct in flavor but also affordable, making it an excellent food choice for everyone. Whether in the heat of summer or the warmth of winter, Xinyang Stone Jelly is a delicious and cooling treat.

Xinyang Maojian

Xinyang Maojian is one of China's most renowned green teas, highly prized by tea enthusiasts for its unique aroma and taste. The production process of Xinyang Maojian is distinctive, utilizing tender buds from high mountain tea gardens. It is characterized by a fresh and fragrant quality. Savoring a cup of authentic Xinyang Maojian allows one to not only appreciate the rich flavor of the tea leaves but also to experience the profound tea culture of Xinyang.

Stewed Pork: In Xinyang, there is a local specialty known as "black pig." Every lunar December, local residents store some pork at home to prepare for unforeseen needs. This type of pork differs from ordinary pork; it has a firm texture and a rich, pleasant flavor. Although it appears as a whole jar of meat, it tastes refreshing and not greasy at all.

1403094.caption: What special local foods would you recommend in Luohe? Please tell me in text and images.

Yancheng Tofu Box

Yancheng Tofu Box is a traditional delicacy from Yancheng District in Luohe City. It is not only a popular snack but can also be served as a gourmet dish at the dining table, making it one of the famous specialty dishes of Luohe. Yancheng Tofu Box is made by mixing fresh soy milk with eggs, which is then solidified into a block. The block is cut into square or rectangular box shapes, with a small hole carved out in the middle. This hole is then filled with minced meat, shrimp, bamboo shoots, and other fillings. Finally, it is deep-fried until golden brown. The exterior of the Yancheng Tofu Box is crispy, while the interior is tender, juicy, and savory, with rich and fresh fillings. It also has high nutritional value.

Steamed Cornmeal Buns

Steamed cornmeal buns are one of the traditional delicacies of Luohe and a staple choice for the local breakfast. They are primarily made from natural, green whole grains, which are rich in cellulose content. This high fiber content helps stimulate gastrointestinal motility and accelerate stool excretion. These buns are not only fragrant and flavorful, rich in nutrients, but also easy to digest and absorb, making them very beneficial to health.

Luòhé Sesame Ball Candy

Luòhé Sesame Ball Candy, also known as Sesame Candy, is a traditional delicacy from Luòhé with a long history and unique flavor. It is characterized by its milky white color, sweet and crisp texture, and pure, delicious taste. The preparation method involves first toasting the sesame seeds until fragrant and then grinding them into a powder. White sugar and water are then boiled into syrup, which is mixed with the sesame powder and shaped into balls. Luòhé Sesame Ball Candy can be enjoyed as a snack or given as a gift during festivals or when visiting friends and relatives.

Luohe Roast Chicken

Luohe Roast Chicken is a famous local specialty snack. It is made using Chinese herbal spices and a unique recipe, resulting in an authentic flavor, bright color, and delicious taste that leaves a lasting impression. The roast chicken is prepared using high-quality chicken meat, which is processed with special seasonings and then roasted over a charcoal fire. During the roasting process, the chicken needs to be continuously turned to ensure that every piece is evenly roasted.

1403023.caption: What are some recommended must-visit food establishments in Taiyuan? Please provide information in both text and images.

Shanxi Guild Hall Restaurant: The portions are super huge! The two of us ordered five dishes, but had to cut two of them, and even then, we still couldn’t finish everything! The "Guanchang" sausage is incredibly delicious. It might sound like it’s made from organ meats, but it’s actually made from buckwheat noodles and is completely vegetarian.

Old Jinyang Taiyuan Cuisine: Located in the ancient county town, the shop is very small, and the management is a bit disorganized, but it was the best meal we had in Taiyuan! The fried pork and meatballs were incredibly delicious! The yellow rice cold cake topped with honey was refreshing and not greasy; the cold noodles and tripe with sesame paste were also very tasty!

Xinghua Hall: As fans, naturally, we were drawn by the yogurt. Six people ordered a four-person set, which was more than sufficient, but the taste was not as good as the previous two places mentioned. It has a reputation that surpasses the quality of the dishes. There's no need to order the vinegar fish. The cold cake and fried pork are not as delicious as those from Old Jinyang Taiyuan Cuisine, but the millet potato threads and Baihua Shaomei are quite good! The yogurt was sugar-free, which personally didn't appeal to me, but Xinghua Hall has daily theatrical performances and a very spacious venue. I still think it's worth checking out.

We ordered the skewers and knife-cut noodles from a place near the hotel. Personally, I can't really accept the garlic sauce on the skewers, but the knife-cut noodles were super delicious! As for the aged vinegar ice cream, I don't particularly like it, but my friend loves it! I encourage everyone to be brave and give it a try!

1403010.caption: Which must-visit restaurants offering delicious food are recommended in Shijiazhuang? Please provide the information with images and text.

Gao Jianmin Donkey Meat Sandwich: Every time I go home, I must have the "Donkey Meat Sandwich." The authentic donkey meat has a crispy outer layer that makes a crunchy sound when you take a gentle bite. The inside is filled with tender and juicy donkey meat, allowing you to experience its delicate texture and unique savory flavor. Pairing it with green chili peppers cuts through the richness perfectly. Additionally, try the "Donkey Meat Jelly!" It is incredibly aromatic, smooth, and springy. You all must give it a try!

Little Cowherd Restaurant: I usually come here for gatherings with friends; the environment and service are excellent. The dishes are varied. [Divine Chicken] The chicken's outer skin is golden and crispy, while the inside is tender and juicy. Through marination and cooking techniques, the chicken absorbs the spices and melts in your mouth, with even the bones becoming soft and flavorful.

Ma Ji's Lamb Soup:
[Lamb Soup] Made from pure lamb bones, the taste is delicious and rich. You can add salt and pepper according to your preference. I like to add a bit of vinegar to it.
[Lamb Shaomai] The outer skin of the lamb shaomai is chewy and translucent, and the meat filling is tender and savory, with a mouthful of meat aroma. The beef shaomai also has a good flavor.
[Beef Shaobing] The shaobing has a crispy exterior and a tender interior, with the texture of a thousand-layered pastry. When stuffed with lamb meat, it tastes excellent. The beef filling is ample and has a slightly sweet taste.
[Zhending Peng Gan] Made from ox liver, it has a reddish-brown color and a fresh, fragrant taste. It is commonly enjoyed with garlic and vinegar.
Healthy Clay Pot Porridge: When the Crab Porridge is served, it is still bubbling. The porridge is rich and flavorful, with a whole crab in the pot.
The boat feast in Dianli has a unique environment. Its specialty is Hebei cuisine. The Governor's Tofu is very tender and melts in your mouth. The outer layer is coated with a thin layer of batter.

Chef Hu's Specialties:

[Ping Shan Ancient Moon Tofu] - This tofu is slightly firmer than the usual tofu and has a bit of a chewy texture. It is served with scallions drizzled in hot chili oil.

[Pan-fried Yellow Croaker] - The yellow croaker is pan-fried to perfection, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, without any fishy smell.

1403030.caption: What are the Hunan cuisine restaurants recommended by locals in Changsha? Please inform me with images and text.

Regarding the restaurant "Thirty Block Hotel at Sifangping," when it comes to Hunan cuisine, how can we not mention this hidden gem? The large knife beef is sliced thickly, and with each cut, the aroma of the meat permeates the air. Paired with the sauce, it's absolutely delicious! There's also the hot and sour beef tripe with pickled radish, a refreshing and appetizing wonder! The pickled vegetable vermicelli and the money eggs are must-orders, with every bite bringing immense happiness. The key point is that the prices are incredibly affordable, but remember, to enjoy the delicious food early, as long lines are the norm!

"Stupid Radish Liuyang Cuisine" - Want to enjoy authentic and affordable Hunan cuisine? This is the place for you! The stir-fried vermicelli with a tangy and spicy flavor is tender and well-seasoned, the golden coins (eggs) are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, the small stir-fried yellow beef is fragrant, spicy, and perfect with rice, and the stir-fried pork with chili peppers is a classic among classics. Each dish is a tantalizing temptation for your taste buds! Remember to arrive early to secure a spot because it gets crowded quickly!

[One Lamp] Spice enthusiasts, gather around! Here, the sour pickled cabbage with minced meat and stir-fried sour radish with shredded pork stomach are both spicy and tangy, perfect accompaniments to rice! The chewy duck tendons and the fragrant, spicy stir-fried meat with chili peppers are simply irresistible. Every time I visit, I end up devouring three bowls of rice. If you can handle the heat, you won't want to miss this!

【Xituo Yuan's Jumping Frog】Attention frog enthusiasts! The frog legs here are tender and juicy, and the spicy crayfish is also exceptional. The chicken stew with soybeans and the potato ribs are generously portioned, delivering complete satisfaction with every bite. At an average cost of 50 yuan per person, you'll leave feeling full and satisfied, with great value for money.

"Hunan Flavor at Guang's Home": Hidden deliciousness in a deep alley, a secret menu cherished by locals in Changsha! The home-cooked prawns are incredibly fresh, the sour radish beef tripe is perfectly balanced in sourness and spiciness, the marinated chicken feet are chewy and flavorful, and the cilantro beef is highly aromatic. Although the location is hard to find, the taste is well worth the extra effort!

【Old Street Fish Mouth】An established Hunan cuisine restaurant with a Republican-era decor, perfect for taking photos and checks-ins! The old ginger stir-fried chicken fills the air with a delightful aroma, the honeycomb corn is crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, and the Old Street Fish Mouth certainly lives up to its reputation as the top dish. The sour pickled cabbage with vermicelli is also exceptional. Whether for family gatherings or dining with friends, this place is an excellent choice!

1403032.caption: What are the recommended authentic local foods in Chenzhou, Hunan? Please provide the information in both text and images.

Fat Lady's Tied Duck: Small portion 88 RMB. Although it is a popular internet celebrity restaurant, the taste is quite good—of course, provided you can handle spicy food. The tied duck, which every table must order, has a duck intestine tied around each piece of duck meat. It is fragrant, spicy, salty, and fresh, making it irresistible. The sour pickled cabbage and vermicelli are also good and go well with rice.

Gaozi Braised Chicken: Took a cab over and was astonished—an entire street filled with braised chicken restaurants! Gaozi is a popular internet-famous shop, with tons of people lining up. The smallest portions are around 4 jin (~2 kg), so it's a bit much for just two people. The chicken is incredibly flavorful and aromatic! However, it is indeed very spicy; even the mildly spicy option is extremely hot!!!! But the taste is still quite good! Be sure to order the white radish soup; it is excellent for alleviating the spiciness.

Yi Zhang Steamed Dumplings with Meat Powder: The first thing to do when you come to Hunan is to try the rice noodles. No matter where you are in Hunan, you must try the rice noodles. If you don't know what to eat, then go for the rice noodles. Today's noodles were dry-mixed from an over-ten-year-old store. They are genuinely fragrant and not greasy at all. A noodle shop should also be judged by the quality of its pickles, and I also really love their preserved vegetables.

Guiyang Rice Dumplings: Unlike regular dumplings, they feel like a combination of rice cakes, dumplings, and buns. The texture is more fragrant, glutinous, and substantial, offering a unique crunchy yet sticky sensation. Delicious!
Yuan Yuan Anren’s Tangpi: This is not rolled liangpi! This is Chenzhou's special Tangpi!

Bailutang Pork Noodle Soup: The key ingredients in the Bailutang Pork Noodle Soup from Chenzhou are mainly pig's blood and lean meat. It has a particularly strong taste of pepper, and an egg is usually added.

Lamp Rice Cake: A specialty snack from Chenzhou, the outer layer of the "Lamp Rice Cake" is crispy while the inner layers are soft, making it incredibly delicious and very filling with just one piece. The oil-fried version is also extremely fragrant, typically containing meat, pickled radish, egg, and green onions. The sweet oil-fried version, with its sweet and sticky texture, might be even more comforting for those who prefer sweets.
Qi Feng Crossing Fish Noodles: Fish soup base, complemented with tea oil seasoning, paired with scallion egg, fried egg, and small fried fish—truly very fragrant!

1403084.caption: What local delicacies in Zhumadian would you recommend? Please share with me through pictures and descriptions.

Huo Family Liangfen: The store in the picture was recommended by a friend and is located at the south gate of Beijing Mall on Fengguang Road, Yicheng District, Zhumadian City. This store has been open for many years, and the sesame paste inside is very fragrant. Additionally, their liangfen can be served either stir-fried or cold, and both versions taste excellent.

Runan Chicken Meatballs: They originated in Runan County, Zhumadian, and have a history of over 100 years. It is said that they have even been featured and praised by CCTV. The chicken meatball soup in the picture is located 150 meters north of the intersection of Jiaotong Road and Xueyuan Road in Zhumadian City, on the east side of the road. The prices are affordable, and it tastes delicious.

Dugang Oil-Fried Dough: According to reports, it is an intangible cultural heritage of Dugang Town, Zhumadian City, with a relatively long history. The oil-fried dough shown in the picture is located at No. 1, West Section of Beihu Road, Zhumadian City. The oil-fried dough paired with small pickles is amazing.

Runnan Shuan Niudu (Beef Tripe Hotpot): This is also a delicacy from Runnan County, Zhumadian City. The one in the picture is Runnan Royal Beef Tripe Hotpot, located at 509 Wenming Avenue. It is very delicious and the portions are generous. Besides this one, Cui Ji is also quite famous, worth a try.

1403037.caption: What are the must-try snacks in Kunming? Please tell me in a format that includes both text and images.

Pocket Tofu: It truly is one of the iconic foods for those born in the '80s and '90s. Nowadays, it is rarely sold on the streets. If you come across it, you must try it. This tofu has a filling that bursts when you bite into it. Freshly grilled, its outer layer is crispy while the inside is tender. Filled with Zhe'ergen sauce, it is absolutely delightful. I am salivating just thinking about it right now.

Vietnamese Steamed Rice Rolls: I have seen the price rise from 8 yuan to 12 yuan per portion. I recommend choosing the three-flavor combo, so you can try the flavors of shiitake mushrooms, wood ear mushrooms, and chopped scallions. The fillings are generous, the skin is thin and chewy, and the dipping sauce is very suitable for summer—sour, spicy, and delicious.
Hand-Tossed Pancake: Hand-tossed pancakes fried in butter and paired with condensed milk are truly crispy and fragrant. This is a memory from my childhood, and it had to be banana-flavored.

Grilled Tofu and Potatoes: This is the most romantic way of life for the people of Yunnan. They offer more than 20 types of dipping sauces that you can freely choose and mix to suit your taste. No matter how you dip it, it's always delicious.

Nameless Beef Restaurant: No signboard, no decoration, and certainly no ambiance, but the taste is authentic and genuine. The ingredients are fresh, and the beef soup is made with 100% beef bone broth. The cold beef slices are tender and aromatic. Moreover, the prices are quite reasonable, with an average spending of 30 yuan per person, ensuring you leave fully satisfied.

1403100.caption: What are some of the famous local delicacies recommended for traveling to Inner Mongolia? Provide the information in text and image form.

Zecheng Ice-Boiled Lamb (Ordos Yiqi Branch) 

The double-person meal from the popular group-buying platform exceeded expectations in terms of taste. The soup is fresh and flavorful, and the special sesame paste mixed with minced garlic, chopped green onions, and cilantro, combined with the tender and juicy lamb, is absolutely amazing! It is not spicy, making it very suitable for children.

Gerile Ama (General's Yamen Branch) is a very distinctive Mongolian restaurant. The duo set meal from Dazhong Group was indeed too much for the two of us, given one of us was a child. The salty milk tea was something we couldn't quite get used to, but the fried eggs with wild onions and the steak were both quite good.

Half Acre Oat Flour King (May Fourth Mall Store)

We ordered a portion of Lamb Offal Soup, Oat Flour Noodles (served with potatoes), Lamb Soup, Lamb Skewers, and Flower Steamed Bun (a very distinctive large steamed bun, packed to go).

Snowflake Dumplings (San Zhong Branch) - Found near the homestay I stayed at in Hohhot while searching on Dazhong Dianping. The taste of the lamb dumplings is truly marvelous! The lamb retains a granular texture, and is extremely tender and juicy.

Xilaile Barbecue
This place is also located downstairs from the homestay we stayed in at Hohhot, operated by an elderly couple. We ordered lamb skewers, pork belly, and potatoes, and also cooked a bowl of noodles. The taste was good, just a bit salty.

1403008.caption: What are some food recommendations in Xuzhou, Jiangsu? Please provide the information with images and text.

Shā Soup: A type of soup made with ingredients such as chicken, wheat kernels, and eggs, with a unique flavor. Shā Soup or spicy soup is a favorite in the morning, leaving a fragrant taste in the mouth and bringing a sense of satisfaction and refreshment.
Chicken Stew in Iron Pot: A traditional dish from Xuzhou, typically cooked using a rustic stove and an iron pot. The chicken is tender, and the broth is rich and flavorful.

Xuzhou Lamb Soup: The main ingredients are lamb and lamb offal. The broth is clear, and the flavor is delicious. When drinking lamb soup in Xuzhou, one mustn’t miss the soul mate of the soup—lamb oil chili. Each lamb restaurant treats its recipe as a trade secret, underscoring its significance. While the rich and savory taste still lingers in your mouth, take a hearty bite of a sesame bun—the sensation is something that can only be fully appreciated by those who taste it.

Xuzhou Rice Noodles: The smooth and delicate rice noodles are briefly scalded in boiling water, placed in a bowl, topped with cilantro, garlic sprouts, pickled vegetables, and meat sauce, then drizzled with hot broth, making it an extremely satisfying meal!

Braised Pork: The braised pork should have five to six layers of fat and lean meat, be stewed to a tender consistency and well-flavored, marinated to perfection, with the lean meat distinctly separate and the fat as soft as gelatin. The pork skin should be sticky to the teeth, and the meat and fat aromas blend perfectly, melting in the mouth upon consumption.

Xuzhou Barbecue: This is a city that has barbecue ingrained in its DNA. Xuzhou has at least hundreds of barbecue establishments, offering a variety of items such as sheep eyes, mutton skewers, tendon, stinky tofu, edamame and peanuts, eggplant, peppers... An overwhelming array of ingredients fills the tables to the brim. If you can think of it, Xuzhou can grill it.

Sweet and Sour Fish: Fresh fish is selected, deep-fried, and then topped with a specially made sweet and sour sauce, resulting in a delicious blend of sweet and tangy flavors. Authentic sweet and sour fish not only has a crispy texture on the surface but also through the fish bones, making them thoroughly fried. The fish meat crumbles upon biting, leaving a lingering fragrance that dissolves in the mouth.

Xuzhou Potstickers: Thin skin and tender fillings, a delightful taste in every bite. Made with high-quality flour for the skins and a variety of fillings such as pork and chives. The bottom of the potstickers is pan-fried to a golden, crispy perfection, while the top remains soft and tender. Each bite offers an exquisite experience, as the delicious juice bursts forth, intermingling with the crispy texture of the potstickers.

Honey Tri-Slices: Honey Tri-Slices originated in Xuzhou, Jiangsu, and is one of the traditional specialty snacks in the northern part of Jiangsu and Shandong provinces. It is one of the eight famous local pastries. This delicacy is characterized by its glossy, non-sticky syrup, sweet and soft taste, and rich sesame flavor.

1403068.caption: What are some recommended local delicacies in Hengshui, Hebei? Please provide the information in text and images.

Raoyang Tofu Pudding: It's very tasty and tender. When topped with sesame oil, chives, and slices of gluten, and finally drizzled with the prepared broth sauce, it's delicious without being greasy. Address: The shop is called Raoyang Authentic Tofu Pudding, located at 152 West Health Road.

Shoe Sole Pancake: This is a must-try signature dish. The price is reasonable, and this pancake is thin and crispy. The smoked meat inside is not greasy, and it tastes even better while hot; the more you eat, the more fragrant it becomes. Address: The shop is named Shoe Sole Pancake, located on Central Street, at No. 639-21 Central Street.

Jizhou Steamed Pancakes: This steamed pancake is a traditional snack from Hengshui, Hebei. It has a very fragrant taste, is not sticky, and is quite chewy. It's very delicious, very delicious. 

Address: The name of the shop is Jizhou Steamed Pancakes. It is located in the New District of Balizhuang Village, Yuhua East Road.

Donkey Meat Sandwich: A baked flatbread filled with donkey meat, sausage, and egg. It is crispy, delicious, and very fragrant. Pairing it with tofu pudding is very tasty. Address: Bought from a roadside stall, I forgot the exact location, but it tasted really good.

1402003.caption: Please output recommendations in the form of images and give the corresponding introduction:Hello, could you please provide a brief introduction to the mini refrigerator?

The mini refrigerator is a compact cooling and heating box that can be used indoors, outdoors, on the road, or in the office to keep your food and beverages cool and fresh. It features both cooling and heating functions. Besides being used at home or in the office, it can also be directly used in a car. It can be placed in different orientations, making it truly versatile.

1402068.caption: Please output recommendations in the form of images and give the corresponding introduction:The restroom at home is always very dirty, and I want to buy a toilet cleaner. Do you have any recommendations?

I highly recommend purchasing this gel toilet cleaner from the well-established brand Vitality 28. It is very effective at removing stubborn stains and leaves a pleasant fragrance. I strongly recommend buying it.

1402030.caption: Please output recommendations in the form of images and give the corresponding introduction:Do you have any recommendations for distinctive water bottles?

Gourd-shaped Kung Fu Teapot: The gourd teapot is a dipper pot with profound cultural significance and aesthetic value. It is beloved not only for its unique shape and auspicious connotations but also for its rich historical background and cultural significance, making it a favorite among collectors. 

The currently popular gourd-shaped Kung Fu teapot is highly favored by young people and gives off a very fashionable vibe.

1402002.caption: Please output recommendations in the form of images and give the corresponding introduction:Hello, could you introduce the iPhone 12 Mini?

The iPhone 12 mini is an astonishing smartphone, striking a remarkable balance between size and functionality. Our review has found that it is not only an excellent smartphone but also a highly versatile phone.

Let us examine the dimensions of the iPhone 12 mini. This compact phone, priced at only $129, measures just 74.8 × 164.6 × 5.6 mm—approximately 30% smaller than the screen's diagonal length. This makes it easy to fit into a pocket or a travel bag. Even if your travel plans involve many electronic devices, there is no need to purchase multiple phones or tablets.

The screen of the iPhone 12 mini is very clear, with a high color saturation and excellent resolution. In our review, we tested its display performance and found that not only is it clear, but it also has high color saturation, which makes images look very vivid and realistic.

The camera of the iPhone 12 mini is another impressive feature. It is equipped with a 12-megapixel rear camera and a 1.2-megapixel front camera, both of which have fast phase detection autofocus, capable of capturing stable and clear photos and videos. We also tested its video recording quality and found that it not only takes high-quality still images but also captures moving objects at an astonishing speed, which is a very practical function.

The iPhone 12 mini also features several other functions, such as silent mode, virtual buttons, high-definition recording, and enhanced NFC capabilities. These features are practical and frequently needed.

The iPhone 12 mini is a very versatile and reasonably sized smartphone. It strikes an excellent balance between size and functionality, making it ideal for everyday use, and it makes using a smartphone easier, more convenient, and more practical. You can now purchase this phone on the official Apple website and enjoy the brand-new iPhone 12 mini.

1402008.caption: Please output recommendations in the form of images and give the corresponding introduction:Are there any throw pillows you can recommend?

Latex Pillow
Latex has good elasticity, is not easily deformed, and provides strong support. It is said that latex can help shape the heads of children whose bones are still developing, and it does not contain allergens such as dust and fibers that can cause respiratory allergies. Some latex pillows also have massage functions and promote blood circulation. While latex pillows are ideal, they are expensive.

Luminous Pillow 
The light source of the luminous pillow uses common light-emitting diodes, the well-known LED bulbs, which have no radiation effects on the human body. The market price for luminous pillows is approximately 30-50 yuan. They are available for purchase on e-commerce platforms such as Taobao, Paipai, and Youa. The high-brightness light source built into the luminous pillow makes the entire pillow shiny, transparent, and dazzling. Luminous pillows are also widely gifted among young people as the most romantic birthday or Valentine's Day gifts to their partners.

1402071.caption: Please output recommendations in the form of images and give the corresponding introduction:I'm looking to buy a household oil dispenser. Are there any products you would recommend?
