This place was frequented by ancient scholars and generals stationed in Yulin, who left their inscriptions here, making Red Rock Gorge one of the precious treasure troves of Great Wall calligraphy art. Visitors can also appreciate stone carvings from the Song and Yuan dynasties.

1102023.caption: Which city is this photo from? Can you provide me with more landscape photos of this city and give a brief introduction as well?

This photograph depicts the Daqing Mountain in Baotou City, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. It is a magnificent natural mountain range. There was a time when I hiked on this mountain, witnessing its grandeur, breathing in its fresh air, and experiencing the charm of nature. In Baotou Daqing Mountain, I found peace of mind and developed a deep love for nature. Other notable landmarks in this city include:

1. Baotou Wudangzhao: Located in Baotou City, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, it is a well-known Tibetan Buddhist temple. I once visited this place and admired the architectural features and rich Buddhist culture of Wudangzhao. At Baotou Wudangzhao, I experienced the power of faith and found inner peace as well.

2. Jiufeng Mountain, Baotou: Located in Baotou City, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, this is a beautiful natural mountain range. I once hiked and climbed here, experiencing the magnificent scenery of Jiufeng Mountain, breathing in the fresh air, and feeling the charm of nature. At Jiufeng Mountain, I found peace of mind and developed a deep love for nature.

3. Ma Chi Ancient City in Baotou: Located in Baotou City, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, this is an ancient city with a profound history. I once strolled through this place, experiencing the magnificent scenery of the ancient city and feeling the deep historical heritage of Baotou. In Ma Chi Ancient City, I found a sense of inner peace and developed a deep love for history.

1102048.caption: Which city is this photo of? Could you provide me with more landscape photos of this city and give a brief introduction to them?

This photograph depicts the Pavilion of Prince Teng located in Nanchang, Jiangxi Province. This historic pavilion has witnessed the transformations of Nanchang over the ages and has hosted countless gatherings of scholars and literati. Visiting the Pavilion of Prince Teng is most enjoyable in autumn or spring, when the climate is pleasant and the scenery is beautiful. "The setting sun and solitary duck fly together; the autumn waters share a hue with the extended sky." The Pavilion of Prince Teng truly combines grandeur and romance into one magnificent Jiangnan pavilion. The moment the lights are turned on at night, it feels as if one is transported back to the flourishing Tang Dynasty! Additional notable landmarks in this city are as follows:

1. Shengjin Pagoda: Located on the east side of Shengjin Pagoda Street in the Xihu District of Nanchang, this thousand-year-old Buddhist pagoda offers a unique experience. Although the interior space is small, each floor presents different views and stories. Climbing to the top provides a panoramic view of the entire city of Nanchang, and the scenery is extraordinarily spectacular. The Shengjin Pagoda Temple Fair, which starts at the end of September each year and runs through the National Day holiday, is a major highlight, featuring activities centered around food, folklore, and rituals.

2. Nanchang Star Ferris Wheel: Located on the banks of the Gan River in the Honggutan New District of Nanchang City, this is one of the iconic structures of Nanchang. Standing at a height of 160 meters, this Ferris wheel not only allows you to overlook the panoramic view of Nanchang but also provides a unique sightseeing experience. From the Ferris wheel, you can enjoy the beautiful scenery on both sides of the Gan River and the bustling night view of Nanchang City.

3. Bayi Square: Located in the center of Nanchang, it is an important site commemorating the August 1st Uprising. At the center of the square stands the Bayi Nanchang Uprising Monument, surrounded by attractions such as musical fountains and military history relief sculptures. It is an excellent place to learn about the revolutionary history of Nanchang.

1102049.caption: Which city is this photo of? Could you provide me with more scenic photos of this city and introduce them to me?

This photograph depicts the Tongtianyan Scenic Area in Zhanggong District, Ganzhou City, Jiangxi Province. The area was first carved out during the Tang Dynasty and flourished in the Northern Song Dynasty. Up to the present day, it preserves 359 stone statues from the Tang to Song Dynasties, as well as 128 cliff inscriptions from the Song Dynasty to the Republic of China. It is acclaimed as the "Number One Grotto in Jiangnan." Additional landscapes of this city include:

1. Sanbai Mountain Scenic Area: It has a planned total area of 138 square kilometers, encompassing Dongfeng Lake, Jiuqu Stream, Fuao Pond, Yangtian Lake, and Sanjie Pool, as well as two major attractions: Hugang Hot Spring and Dongshengwei, amounting to a total of 165 scenic spots. It is recognized as a national-level scenic and historic interest area and a national AAAA-rated tourist attraction.

2. Cradle of the Republic Tourist Area: It is one of the first nationwide patriotism education demonstration bases announced by the Central Propaganda Department. It is also one of the classic scenic spots for red tourism in the country and was officially rated as a National AAAA-level tourist attraction in 2008.

3. Nanwudang Mountain Scenic Area: With a total planned area of 13.5 square kilometers and a main peak elevation of 864 meters, ninety-nine extraordinary peaks rise abruptly from the flat ground, stretching over several kilometers like a splendid painting unfolding slowly along National Highway 105.

1102072.caption: Which city's photo is this? Could you provide more landscape photos of this city and introduce them?

This photograph depicts Mengding Mountain in Ya'an, Sichuan, a national 4A-level tourist attraction covering an area of 54 square kilometers. The five connected peaks here resemble a lotus flower, presenting a spectacular and beautiful view. The imperial tea from this area is well-known, earning it the nickname "Hometown of Celestial Tea." Key points of interest such as Tiangai Temple, Ganlu Stone Chamber, and Yongxing Temple are all worthwhile places for sightseeing and visiting. The area experiences mild summers and winters but has relatively high rainfall, earning it the moniker "Rain City." Additional notable sights in this city include:

1. **Qianfo Cliff Rock Carvings**: The Qianfo Cliff rock carvings commenced during the third year of the Longshuo era of the Tang Dynasty and were completed in the seventh year of the Kaiyuan era, spanning a total of 57 years. There are a total of 54 niches and over 3,000 statues, accompanied by six inscriptions and two steles. The entire sculptural group consists of niches depicting the Transformation Scene of the Pure Land, the Eight Classes of Dragon and Deities, the Preaching Scene, the Seven-story Pagoda, and the Thousand Buddha Screen.

2. Anshun Field: Anshun Field is located on the south bank of the middle reaches of the Dadu River in the southwestern part of Sichuan Province. It is rated as a national AAAA-level tourist attraction. The site features a memorial room for the Red Army's forced crossing of the Dadu River, exhibiting 47 items including weapons and lanterns used by the Red Army, as well as 80 photographs. It also displays inscriptions by veteran revolutionaries such as Liu Bocheng and Nie Rongzhen. The site houses a considerable collection of cultural relics and is historically significant as the place where the entire army led by the famous military leader of the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom, Wing King Shi Dakai, was annihilated. Additionally, it serves as a revolutionary memorial site commemorating the victory of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army in the forced crossing of the Dadu River battle.

3. NiuBei Mountain: NiuBei Mountain is a scenic spot located within the territory of Yanjing County, Yan'an city. It gets its name due to the ridge's resemblance to a cow's back. The area is primarily composed of mountains such as Wild Cow Mountain, Big Wild Cow Mountain, and Niangniang Mountain, with the highest peak reaching an elevation of 3,666 meters. The mountain boasts not only beautiful and magnificent natural scenery but also features famous attractions like Wild Cow Mountain, Pumai Land, and Xiejiao Valley. Over the years, it has attracted numerous tourists for hiking, mountaineering, photography, and sightseeing. It is now recognized as China's largest viewing platform.

4. Jiajin Mountain:

Jiajin Mountain is located at the junction of Baoxing County in Ya'an City, Sichuan, and Xiaojin County in Aba Prefecture. Covering an area of 839 square kilometers, it is part of the Qionglai mountain range. The peak stands at an altitude of 4,260 meters and serves as the boundary between Baoxing and Xiaojin counties. It is also a habitat for giant pandas. The scenic area includes diverse attractions such as alpine lakes, Red Army historical sites, ethnic customs, and a semi-wild conservation area for giant pandas. Jiajin Mountain has been listed as a UNESCO World Natural Heritage site and has been included in the Ministry of Culture and Tourism's list of national boutique rural tourism routes.

1102015.caption: Which city is this photo from? Could you provide me with more landscape photos of this city and give an introduction to them?

This photograph depicts the Hukou Waterfall of the Yellow River in Linfen City, Shanxi Province. It is the largest yellow waterfall in the world and a renowned spectacle of the Yellow River. The rushing waters of the Yellow River surge and form a magnificent scene described as "the vast Yellow River collected in one pot." The roaring sound of the waterfall is immensely powerful and awe-inspiring. Experiencing the waterfall up close is breathtaking and leaves one in wonder! Other attractions in this city include:

1. Hongtong Dahuaishu Ancestor-seeking and Worship Park: The Hongtong Dahuaishu Ancestor-seeking and Worship Park is the nation's only sacred site for folk worship. The park covers a vast area and is divided into different tour themes. Visitors follow in the footsteps of their ancestors and touch the places where their forebears lived under the large pagoda tree. Visiting the Hongtong Dahuaishu, seeking roots, and remembering ancestors is a must-experience event.

2. Guangsheng Temple: This is an ancient architectural complex from the Yuan and Ming dynasties. Its three major attractions are the Feihong Pagoda, the Yuan dynasty murals in the Shuishen Temple, and the "Zhaocheng Jin Tripitaka." Among these, the Feihong Pagoda is the most complete and oldest glazed pagoda in existence, as well as the tallest multicolored glazed pagoda in the world. It is known as the "Peerless Glazed Pagoda" and is dazzlingly magnificent.

3. Yunqiu Mountain Scenic Area: It is a sacred site where Confucianism, Taoism, and Buddhism converge. The natural landscapes are unique, and it is rich in tourist resources. Known as a picturesque and pleasant natural oxygen bar, it has the reputation of being the "most beautiful peak of Guyi Mountain" and the "first scenic spot of He Fen." The mystical and captivating group of ten-thousand-year-old ice caves and the idyllic ancient village of Tapo are must-visit attractions in Yunqiu Mountain.

4. Xiaoxitian: This is a Zen Buddhist temple built by Phoenix Mountain. It is renowned for its rare suspended sculpture art and intricate architecture, and is considered a "masterpiece of suspended sculpture" in the history of Chinese sculpture art. The temple is surrounded by dense forests and a serene environment, with the halls filled with stunning and breathtaking suspended sculptures that leave a profound impression on visitors.

1102097.caption: Which city is this photo from? Could you provide me with more landscape photos of this city and introduce them to me?

This photograph depicts the Crescent Spring at Crescent Lake in Mingsha Mountain, Jiuquan, Gansu. Mingsha Mountain, one of China's most beautiful deserts, is renowned for the continuous sound of sand dunes. A clear spring, crescent-shaped, located within the sand mountains, holds the title of "The First Spring in the Desert," symbolizing the coexistence of sand and water, and the interdependence of mountains and springs. Riding a camel to admire the vast desert scenery, climbing the sand dunes to watch a desert sunset, witnessing the twilight and resplendent crescent waters, all merge to create a series of majestic and boundless desert landscapes. Further attractions in this city include:

1. Mogao Caves: The Mogao Caves, a millennium-old Buddhist art sanctuary, is the world's largest and most richly endowed Buddhist site. Entering the grottoes and observing the myriad statues and lifelike murals up close is truly awe-inspiring! The murals inside the caves have retained their vivid colors over the millennia, bearing witness to the passage of time.

2. Yardang Geological Park: Dunhuang Yardang Geological Park is known as one of the three most beautiful yardang landforms in China. It is also the largest and most spectacular yardang landform cluster discovered in the world to date. After prolonged weathering and erosion, the towering yardangs take on myriad shapes, creating a stunning contrast with the vast, boundless desert and Gobi around them. This scene is imbued with a sense of magical charm and conveys an intrinsic feeling of mysterious desolation. If you have the opportunity, you can also witness a sunset here. The golden sunset serves as the most beautiful filter, making it an ideal spot for photography and a must-visit location.

3. The Yumenguan Pass: Yumenguan Pass, one of the nine significant passes in China, was also an important checkpoint on the Silk Road during the Han Dynasty. Visit the remnants of the Han Great Wall and experience the passage of time over millennia; the solitary smoke rising in the vast desert and the boundless expanse of sky and earth are vividly displayed here. Listen to the tales of the past and feel the unique charm of this ancient pass.

4. Son of the Earth: Son of the Earth is a major outdoor sculpture made primarily of red sandstone. The sculpture resembles a gigantic "giant baby," becoming a significant spectacle in this desert Gobi region. Standing next to the Son of the Earth, one feels the insignificance of humans. Besides the Son of the Earth, Guazhou also features sculptures like Hanwu Heroism and Infinity, all of which are breathtaking artworks worth visiting. Experiencing art in the desert Gobi is incredibly awe-inspiring.

5. Jinta Populus Euphratica Forest: The Jinta Populus Euphratica Forest is the largest man-made forest in the Hexi Corridor. With the Populus euphratica trees as its main feature, visitors can also explore the vast golden desert and the shimmering Jinku Lake. This area is renowned as the most beautiful place in Gansu during the autumn. October is the peak season for visiting this scenic spot, where the golden hues of the Populus euphratica trees ignite the passion of autumn. The mottled shadows of the trees reflect on the lake's surface, offering a serene and picturesque beauty, as well as a desolate yet sublime loneliness, making one feel as if they are wandering within a painting.

1102042.caption: Which city's photo is this? Could you provide me with more scenic photos of this city and introduce them to me?

This photograph depicts Yandang Mountain located in Wenzhou City, Zhejiang Province, also known as Yanshan or Yanyan. It is renowned as the "Famous Mountain on the Sea, Supreme Beauty Within the World" and is praised as the "First Mountain in Southeast China." Yandang Mountain is divided into South Yandang Mountain and North Yandang Mountain. The area north of the Oujiang Fault is called North Yandang, while the area south of it is called South Yandang. The main peak, Baigangjian, has an elevation of 1057 meters and a total area of 450 square kilometers.

Further notable landscapes of this city include:

1. Jiangxin Islet: Located in the middle reach of the Oujiang River, north of Wenzhou's urban area, it has an elongated east-west shape and is narrow from north to south. It is one of China's four famous islets. The scenery of this islet is picturesque, with its dual towers standing tall against the sky, complementing the Jiangxin Temple, which has long been referred to as the "Penglai of the Oujiang River." Famous poets throughout history, such as Xie Lingyun, Meng Haoran, Han Yu, Lu You, and Wen Tianxiang, have left their marks on Jiangxin Islet.

2. Nanji Island: A national nature reserve and the main island of the Nanji Archipelago Marine Nature Reserve. Also known as Haishan, it was historically referred to as "Nanjishan." It is located 30 nautical miles off the coast of Aojiang in Pingyang County, Zhejiang Province, in the East China Sea, and 50 nautical miles from the urban area of Wenzhou. Nanji Island is the largest of the 52 islands in the Nanji Archipelago and is a tourist island. The surrounding area is filled with numerous islets and reefs, with the highest point, Dashan, reaching an altitude of 229.1 meters. The island has a population of around 2,000 residents.
3. Hometown of Liu Bowen: The Hometown of Liu Bowen is a "Zhejiang Cultural Identity" cultivation project.

4. Nanxi River: Located in Yongjia County, in the northern part of Wenzhou City, Zhejiang Province, it is situated 26 kilometers south of Wenzhou's urban area, adjacent to Yandang Mountain to the east, and contiguous with Xianju Mountain to the west. Nanxi River is a national AAAA-level tourist area, a national scenic area, and a World Geopark.

1102065.caption: Which city's photo is this? Can you provide me with more landscape photos of this city and introduce them to me?

This photograph depicts Fuxian Lake in Yuxi City, Yunnan Province, the largest plateau lake in China, also known as the "Pearl of the Plateau." The lake water is clear and transparent, the lakeshore scenery is picturesque, and the surrounding areas boast natural landscapes such as Maotianshan and Sakura Valley, making it an ideal place for leisure and vacations. More scenic spots in this city include:

1. Maotianshan: Located in Eshan Yi Autonomous County, Yuxi City, Maotianshan has an altitude of 3,150 meters and is the main peak of Emei Mountain. The mountain is shrouded in mist all year round, resembling a fairyland. The primeval forests, alpine meadows, and unique landforms of Maotianshan attract numerous outdoor enthusiasts and photographers to explore and capture its beauty.

2. Tonghai Xiushan: Tonghai Xiushan is located in Tonghai County, Yuxi City, and is a famous cultural and religious mountain in Yunnan. There are numerous ancient sites on Xiushan, such as the Puguang Temple from the Ming Dynasty and the Yongquan Temple from the Qing Dynasty, as well as natural karst caves, peculiar peaks, and strange stones. It is an excellent place for visitors to learn about the history and culture of Yunnan.

3. Yuxi Cherry Blossom Valley: Located in Hongta District of Yuxi City, the Cherry Blossom Valley is a famous destination in Yunnan for viewing cherry blossoms. In spring, the cherry blossoms in the valley bloom all at once, creating a breathtaking scene akin to clouds or rosy dawn. Additionally, there are distinctive ethnic cultural performances in the valley, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in a rich cultural atmosphere.

4. Jiangchuan Lijiashan: Jiangchuan Lijiashan is located in Jiangchuan County, Yuxi City. It is one of the important sites of the ancient Dian culture. A large number of bronzeware, pottery, jade artifacts, and other cultural relics have been unearthed here, providing valuable physical data for the study of the history and culture of the ancient Dian Kingdom. Visitors can experience the charm of ancient Dian culture here.

1102078.caption: Which city's photos are displayed here? Can you provide me with more landscape photos of this city and introduce them to me?

This photograph depicts Guifeng Mountain National Forest Park in Jiangmen, Guangdong. Guifeng Mountain is renowned for its magnificent landscapes, beautiful lakes, and rich vegetation. Strolling along the verdant forest paths feels like being in a natural oxygen bar, bringing about a sense of relaxation and joy. Yutai Temple on the mountain has a long history and is an important Buddhist sacred site in the Jiangmen area. At sunset, the temple's roof, illuminated by the afterglow, appears particularly solemn and dignified. More attractions in the city are as follows:

1. Kaiping Diaolou Cultural Tourism Area: The Kaiping Diaolou is a unique architectural landscape in the Jiangmen region. These diaolou combine defense, habitation, and the art of both Eastern and Western architecture. They incorporate styles from ancient Greece and Rome, as well as elements from Islamic and other diverse cultures. Each diaolou tells a story of the struggle of overseas Chinese, inspiring deep respect for the history and culture of this land.

2. Chuandao Tourism Resort: Chuandao Tourism Resort attracts numerous tourists with its beautiful natural landscapes and abundant tourism resources. Here, you will find clear blue seas, azure skies, sandy beaches, and coconut groves, as well as a variety of water activities and cultural attractions. Whether you are a visitor looking to relax and unwind, or an adventurer seeking to explore the island's charm, you will find your own enjoyment here.

3. Xiachuan Island Wangfu Tourist Resort: Xiachuan Island Wangfu Tourist Resort is located on the beautiful Xiachuan Island. Here, it boasts exceptional natural conditions and abundant tourism resources. Visitors can fully enjoy the pleasures of sunshine, beaches, and seawater, as well as explore the island's historical relics and cultural landscapes, experiencing the unique charm of this island.

2001043.caption: How to prepare this type of soy sauce boiled pomfret: Please provide the steps in a detailed format with images and text.
When purchasing pomfret, ask the vendor to clean it thoroughly. After washing it at home, score the fish without needing to marinate it.
Onions, or green onions may also be used, should be chopped and set aside. Crush and mince the garlic, and slice the ginger for later use.
Preheat the cast iron pot, add a little oil, and sauté the green onions, ginger, and garlic until fragrant.
Add water to the pot, ensuring the amount is sufficient to fully submerge the fish.
Next, add soy sauce. Sister Crab used approximately 800 milliliters of water, 100 milliliters of soy sauce, and additionally added a pinch of salt.

Place the fish into the pot, cover it with a lid, and bring it to a boil over high heat. Then, reduce to low heat and simmer for 15 minutes. After turning to low heat, replace the lid and ensure it is properly covered. The cast iron pot retains heat well, so keep the lid on.
Afterward, a slight pressure can develop inside the pot, creating an environment that results in more delicious fish with tender and flavorful meat.

After cooking, turn off the heat and let the fish simmer in the pot for a few minutes. If time permits, you can let it simmer a bit longer. Transfer the fish to a plate, drizzling some of the broth from the pot over it, and then add a splash of sesame oil. It's ready to serve—simple, isn't it?

2001023.caption: How to make this quinoa porridge? Please use a visual format to explain the steps to me.
Add water to the pot and bring it to a boil.
Pour into the pot and cook for 10 minutes.

2001017.caption: How to make this kind of mung bean rice porridge? Please explain the steps to me in both text and images.
Soak the dried green beans and lotus seeds in cold water for 2 hours in advance.
Place the mung beans, dried lily bulbs, and rice into the rice cooker.
Activate the porridge function, and the program will end automatically.

2001089.caption: How to make stir-fried carrots with meat? Please teach me the steps using both images and text.
Step 3: Cut the scallions into small sections.
Step 5: Heat oil in a hot pan, add garlic and salt and cook for a while, then add lean meat and stir-fry briefly.
Step 6: After stir-frying the carrots for a while, add water and let it simmer for a while.
Step 7: Finally, add the chopped green onions and stir-fry for a while.

2001021.caption: How to make this kind of Tremella (Silver Ear) porridge? Please provide the steps in a text and picture format to teach me.
Reserve one package of Tremella Fungus Salad.
Boil water in the pot and add white fungus.
Simmer the chanterelle mushrooms for 10 minutes before turning off the heat.

2001001.caption: How to make braised duck meat like this? Please teach me the steps in both text and images.
Steam the duck meat for 40 minutes.
Heat the pan and add duck meat to sear until fragrant.
Add an appropriate amount of soybean paste.
Add an appropriate amount of light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, and pepper.
Pour the braising liquid over it.
It is time to start eating.

2001097.caption: How to make such poached beef? Please use a combination of images and text to teach me the steps.
Step 1: Obtain one fresh beef shank.
Step 2: Place the pot with cold water on the stove, add cooking wine, green onions, and ginger, and bring to a boil over high heat.
Step 3: After blanching, remove and rinse thoroughly, then place in an electric pressure cooker.
Step 4: Add bay leaves, ginger, and salt, then press the button for beef and lamb.

Step 5: The key to this dish is the seasoning sauce: finely chopped green onions, finely chopped garlic, finely chopped cilantro, white sesame seeds, sugar, light soy sauce, sesame oil, and peanut oil. Additionally, add a spoonful of the original broth. If you prefer a spicy flavor, you can add some chopped chili peppers.
Step 6: Once the beef is stewed, remove it and let it cool. You can use ice packs to assist with cooling.
Step 7: After cooling, slice and plate the dish. The thinner the slices, the better they will taste with the dipping sauce.

2001028.caption: How to make this black sesame, red date, and apple porridge? Please use illustrations and text to teach me the steps.
Roast the black sesame seeds and grind them into powder.
Peel, core, and cut the apple into small pieces.
After thoroughly washing all the ingredients, place them into the pot, add an appropriate amount of water, and cook for about half an hour.

2001012.caption: How to make such a toast sandwich? Please provide the steps in a illustrated manner.
Brush oil on the grill, crack an egg onto it, cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Arrange the slices of toast in a row and lay down a piece of plastic wrap underneath (make it slightly larger).
Overlap the slices of toast and wrap them with plastic wrap.
Cut it in the middle and it will be fine.

2001059.caption: How do you make these red date and glutinous rice balls? Please teach me the steps using both text and images.
Prepare the red dates and wash them thoroughly.
Pit the fruit and dice it.
Add glutinous rice flour and stir in the milk.
Knead the dough; make sure it is not too soft, otherwise, it will spread out in the steamer after being cooked.
Pinch off a piece of dough and shape it into a ball.
Add cold water to the pot, then cook for 20 minutes after the water boils.

2001055.caption: How to make this type of pumpkin potato soup? Please provide the steps in a visual and written form.
Peel and dice the potatoes, peel and dice the pumpkin; the pieces need to be small enough.
Add the ingredients into the soy milk maker and activate the thick soup function.
This is breakfast from a certain day. Pumpkin porridge pairs very well with baked cheese rice.

2001091.caption: How to prepare such a dish of stir-fried mushrooms and broccoli? Please explain the steps to me with illustrated instructions.
Step 1: Ingredients: Broccoli (broken into small florets and soaked in salt water for 30 minutes to clean), fresh shiitake mushrooms (soaked in salt water for 30 minutes to clean).
Step 2: Place the fresh shiitake mushrooms on the cutting board and slice them.
Step 3: Add an appropriate amount of salt to the pot of clean water.
Step 4: Add an appropriate amount of oil.
Step 6: Next, add the broccoli and sliced fresh shiitake mushrooms, blanch for 2 minutes, and then remove.
Step 7: Heat the oil in a pan, then add the blanched broccoli and fresh mushrooms and stir-fry them.
Step 8: Then, add an appropriate amount of salt.
Step 9: Season and stir-fry evenly, and it's done.

2001096.caption: How to make this type of Cantonese-style clay pot rice with preserved meats, please teach me the steps using both pictures and text.
Step 1: Prepare the main ingredients: soak the rice for 1 hour in advance; Cantonese-style sausage; Shanghai bok choy.
Step 2: Fill the pot with water, and once the water boils, blanch the green vegetables for 1 minute, then remove and set aside.

Step 4, Pour the Sauce: Mix one tablespoon of fermented black bean fish sauce, two tablespoons of premium soy sauce, one tablespoon of white sugar, two tablespoons of warm water, and a small amount of sesame oil until well combined.
Step 5: Sprinkle a small amount of cooking oil into the clay pot, add the soaked rice, and pour in fresh water until the water just covers the rice.
Step 6: First, bring it to a boil over high heat, then reduce to low heat. Cook until the water is mostly absorbed. Use chopsticks to poke some holes in the rice to ensure even heating.

Step 7: Lay the slices of Chinese sausage evenly over the rice, cover with the lid, drizzle a small amount of cooking oil around the edge of the pot, and simmer on low heat for 5 minutes. Remove the lid, pour in the sauce, add the green vegetables, simmer for an additional 1-2 minutes, and then turn off the heat.
Step 8: The fragrant Cantonese-style preserved meat clay pot rice is complete.
Step 9: Fresh, flavorful, and delicious—achieve clay pot rice freedom right at home.

2001072.caption: How to prepare these garlic butterflied shrimp, please teach me the steps with pictures and text.
Soak the vermicelli in clear water for about half an hour.
Wash the shrimp thoroughly and trim off the antennae. Use a knife to cut open the back of the shrimp and remove the vein. Then make a few more cuts on the shrimp meat.

Prepare the sauce: Combine 1 and 1/2 tablespoons of light soy sauce with a pinch of salt, 1/4 tablespoon of white sugar, 1/4 tablespoon of white pepper powder, and 6 tablespoons of water. Mix well. (You can adjust the quantities of the seasonings according to personal taste.) Peel and finely chop the garlic, then set aside. Heat a pan with 2 tablespoons of oil until the oil reaches about 30-40% of its smoking point. Add the minced garlic and stir-fry until fragrant. Pour in the prepared sauce mixture and bring it to a boil to create a garlic sauce. Evenly spread the soaked vermicelli on a plate, place the prawns on top of the vermicelli, and spoon the garlic sauce over the shrimp and vermicelli.

Bring water to a boil in the pot. Then place the shrimp in the pot, cover, and steam over medium heat for 10 minutes. Remove the steamed shrimp, sprinkle with a suitable amount of chopped green onions. Heat a large spoonful of oil in the pot until hot, then immediately pour it over the green onions.

2001032.caption: How to make this black oat and purple sweet potato porridge: Please teach me the steps using both pictures and text.
Peel the purple sweet potato and cut it into small pieces.
Place it into the pot, add water, and boil for 10 minutes.
Add the black oat flakes and cook for 2 minutes.

2001016.caption: How to make this kind of pumpkin millet porridge? Please teach me the steps using images and text.
Peel the pumpkin and cut it into pieces.
It is time to start eating.

2001065.caption:
How to Make This Cold Dish - Celery, Fungus, and Egg Skin Shreds

Please provide the steps in a text-and-image format.
Prepare all the ingredients. Soak the dried black fungus and dried shrimp until they soften, then clean them thoroughly. Remove the strings from the celery, clean it, and cut it into thin strips.
Beat the eggs, sprinkle with a little salt, pour into the pan, and spread into a thin egg sheet.
Cut the egg skin into strips roughly the same length as the celery. Slice the soaked black fungus, and slightly cut the dried shrimp.
Boil a pot of water and blanch the celery.
When blanching the celery, place the shredded egg skin and black fungus in a large bowl, and season with Sichuan pepper oil and Sichuan pepper salt.
Blanch the celery and cool it in ice water. Place it in a large bowl and mix well. Sprinkle in the dried shrimp, mix thoroughly, and then serve.

2001045.caption: How to make these diced cumin meat cubes? Please provide the steps in a written and pictorial format.
A piece of fresh lamb, pat the surface with kitchen paper to remove excess moisture.
Cut the lamb into cubes approximately 1 cm in width.
Add an appropriate amount of cooking wine, dark soy sauce, cumin, pepper-salt seasoning, white pepper, green onions, and ginger. Mix well and marinate for about 15 minutes.
1-2 water radishes, washed and diced; one dry cucumber, washed and diced.
Heat the frying pan, pour in an appropriate amount of olive oil, add the marinated lamb cubes to the pan, and stir-fry on high heat. Once the meat changes color, remove it from the pan.
In another pan, pour in a small amount of olive oil. After adding the chopped green onions and frying them until fragrant, add the diced lamb.
Stir-fry evenly over medium-low heat, then add a small amount of cumin powder to season.
Add the diced radish and cucumber into the pot, then add a pinch of salt and some black sesame seeds.
After stir-frying evenly, turn off the heat. Serve the dish with some light garnishing, and it is ready to eat.

2001004.caption: How to make garlic sprouts stir-fried with dried tofu: Please teach me the steps using a combination of text and pictures.
Cut the dried tofu into diamond-shaped pieces.
Cut the garlic sprouts into sections and set aside.
In a hot pan with cold oil, add the white parts of the garlic and the dried tofu, and stir-fry.
Add salt and soy sauce, stir well, then pour in a little water and simmer for half a minute.
Add the garlic sprouts leaves and stir-fry evenly.

2001051.caption: How to make this type of caviar and ham easy burger, please provide the steps in illustrated form.
The first step, of course, is to prepare the ingredients.
Cut off all four edges of the toast.
Place the toast in the quanchu retro green toaster, set it to level 2 for heating, and remove it when it automatically pops up.
Press the ham into a circular shape, and the edges can be eaten directly.
The prepared slices of toast should also be pressed into a circular shape. (This time, the toast prepared is relatively small and not very round, so you may choose larger slices of toast.)
Spread a small amount of mayonnaise on the toast, then layer with lettuce and American ham, and finally, add a squeeze of caviar.
Place another slice of toast on top and squeeze a little bit of mayonnaise. Of course, you can add more if you like.
Continue by layering with iceberg lettuce, American ham, and squeeze on some caviar; finally, place a piece of toast on top and it's done.

2001035.caption: How to make sweet potato millet porridge: Please provide the steps in a pictorial format.
Method of Preparation: An appropriate amount of millet and red dates; wash and set aside.
Sweet potatoes should be peeled, then cut into small pieces, and set aside.
Add an appropriate amount of water, and put in a few pieces of rock sugar according to personal preference. Press the button for cooking porridge.
The time has come, and a fragrant pot of porridge is ready to be served.

2001020.caption: How to make this type of Century Egg and Lean Pork Congee? Please guide me through the steps with both text and images.
Cut the meat and preserved eggs into cubes, and slice the ginger into sections.
Add light soy sauce, cooking wine, white pepper powder, and ginger slices, then mix evenly with starch and marinate.
Set the bowl aside for later use.
Press the button for the porridge cooking mode.
Add diced meat and century egg in the remaining twenty minutes.
Add sesame oil two minutes before serving, and sprinkle with chopped green onions.

2001067.caption: How to make such an okra-baked egg? Please teach me the steps in a pictorial format.
Prepare the ingredients: 2 okras, 2 tomatoes, 2 eggs.
Cut the tomato at 1/5 from the top, and use a spoon to scoop out the flesh inside the tomato.
Wash the okra and slice it thinly.
Place the eggs and okra inside the hollowed-out tomatoes, then sprinkle a little salt and add some olive oil.
Put the cut-off top of the tomato back on.
Wrap the tomatoes well with aluminum foil; PS: Wrapping with aluminum foil is to prevent the loss of nutritional moisture, but it is not necessary.
Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius for 25 minutes. PS: Each oven is different, so the temperature and time may vary slightly.

2001024.caption: How can I make this millet and apple porridge? Please provide the steps in a pictorial and textual format.
Wash the millet thoroughly and place it in a pot. Add an adequate amount of clear water.
Add the diced apples, bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for about 15 minutes.
Add brown sugar and goji berries, then simmer for another 5 minutes.

2001034.caption: How to make this kind of corn and kidney bean porridge? Please provide the steps in a visual and written format.
Wash the corn kernels and kidney beans thoroughly.
Boil the water, add green beans and corn kernels, and cook until done.

2001005.caption: How to make stir-fried onions with cured meat, please teach me the steps using both text and images.
Cook the preserved meat for ten minutes.
Take it out and slice it.
Heat the pan and add the cured meat, then stir-fry.
Add an appropriate amount of light soy sauce.
Add the onions and stir-fry until cooked.

2001008.caption: How to make stir-fried loofah with pork: Please provide the steps in a pictorial and written format to teach me.
Add oil to a hot pan, then add salt and garlic and sauté for a while. After that, add lean meat and stir-fry.
Stir-fry the gourd for a while, then add a bit of water, cover the pot, and let it simmer for a while.

2001038.caption: How do you make this kind of cold mixed egg dish? Please teach me the steps using both pictures and text.
Prepare crushed red pepper, minced garlic, and chopped green onions for later use.
Wash the eggs thoroughly, then steam or boil them until cooked.
After cooking, place in cold water to soak for a while, then peel and set aside.
Use an egg slicer to slice the eggs. If you don't have an egg slicer, use a knife.
Pour vegetable oil into the pan, and once heated, add minced garlic to release its fragrance.
Then pour in two tablespoons of light soy sauce, one tablespoon of vinegar, one tablespoon of oyster sauce, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of chicken powder, and mix well.
Pour over the eggs, and it is done.

2001027.caption: How to make this oatmeal and cornmeal porridge, please teach me the steps using illustrations and written explanations.
Mix cornmeal with an appropriate amount of purified water.
After adding an appropriate amount of boiling water to the pot, add the cornmeal paste.
After bringing it to a boil, add the oats and cook until done.
It is time to start eating.

2001082.caption: How to make stir-fried eggs with tomato and beef? Please teach me the steps with images and text.

Step 1: Slice the beef tenderloin thinly, then mix it well with salt, cooking wine, light soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch slurry. After that, add a tablespoon of vegetable oil, mix well, and let it sit for 10 minutes.
Step 2: Wash the tomatoes thoroughly. Cut an "X" on the top, then blanch them in boiling water for one minute to remove the skin.
Step 4: Crack the eggs into a bowl, add salt, cooking wine, and a little water, then beat until well mixed.
Step 5: Heat oil in a pan until hot, pour in the egg mixture and stir-fry until it forms chunks, then remove from the pan and set aside.
Step 6: Add more oil to the pan, and when it reaches fifty percent heat, add the beef slices and stir-fry until they change color, then remove from the pan.
Step 7: Leave some oil in the pan, add the tomatoes, and stir-fry until they become soft and mushy.
Step 8: Add the stir-fried beef and cook for 1 minute.
Step 9: Add the scrambled eggs and Chinese chives, salt to taste, and stir-fry evenly.

2001030.caption: How to make millet walnut porridge like this, please teach me the steps with illustrations and text.
Pour the millet and walnut kernels into the blender, and add an appropriate amount of purified water.
Activate the 10-minute quick rice porridge function key.
After a few minutes, a millet and walnut paste is prepared.

2001037.caption: How to make this kind of vegetarian mixed sauce noodles? Please teach me the steps with both text and images.
Add an appropriate amount of water to the pot and bring it to a boil. Put in the noodles and cook them until done. Transfer the cooked noodles to a bowl for later use.
Add a spoonful of sweet bean sauce, a spoonful of bean paste, water, and starch into a bowl. Stir evenly to complete the sauce.
Chop the pickled vegetables into fine pieces.
Soak the shiitake mushrooms in advance, wash them clean, and cut them into small cubes. Wash the cilantro and cut it into small segments.
Heat a pan with oil, add beaten eggs, stir until scattered, then remove and set aside.
Add diced shiitake mushrooms to the pot and stir-fry for about 1 minute.
Pour in the sauce, add pickled cabbage and eggs, bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce to low heat and simmer for about 1 minute.
Pour the sauce over the noodles, add cilantro, sprinkle with white sesame seeds, and it's done.

2001014.caption: How to make this kind of pumpkin millet porridge? Please teach me the steps with illustrations.
Cut the pumpkin into thin slices.
Place it in the blender and add purified water. The total capacity of my blender should not exceed 700 milliliters.
Press the "Soy Milk" button to blend into slurry.
Pumpkin millet porridge is smooth and free of dregs, with a beautiful orange-yellow color, and has a delicate, fragrant, and sweet taste.

2001040.caption: How to make this type of white agar-agar version of papaya milk pudding, please use illustrated steps to teach me.

Cut a papaya in half and remove the seeds. This method of cutting makes it easier to remove the seeds, but the downside is that it won't sit steadily. Therefore, it is recommended to use the method described in the second step.

The method involves cutting off the top lid, then hollowing out the seeds. To make the papaya sit flat, you can cut a small flat surface at the bottom, which will not affect the appearance of the final product. I have used this method before, but hollowing out the seeds was very laborious. Therefore, this time I used the method from the previous step. However, practice has proven that the previous method is ineffective.
Pour the milk into a saucepan, add the gelatin powder, and cook until small bubbles appear around the edges of the pot, stirring continuously throughout.

Pour it into the papaya after it has cooled slightly. Note that the setting temperature of the jelly powder is relatively high and can solidify at room temperature, so do not leave the milk mixture to cool for too long. If you are not concerned about the papaya becoming overcooked, you can pour it in immediately after removing it from the heat.

I couldn't keep my papaya level and had to prop it up with many things... Try to pour the milk mixture until it is flush with the cut surface of the papaya. Otherwise, the pieces will not look refined and it will affect the presentation.
Cut into pieces and eat. The fragrance of papaya, the smoothness of milk, and the refreshing coolness make it perfect for summer.

2001075.caption: How to make this type of white radish and vermicelli soup, please teach me the steps using both pictures and text.
Cut the white radish into thin strips and set aside. Chop the green onions into small pieces.
Soak the vermicelli in cold water and set aside.

Pour water into the pot. Once the water boils, add shredded white radish and vermicelli. After they are just cooked, continue to boil for another 5-6 minutes until the broth begins to turn slightly white and the flavor of the white radish is released.
After turning off the heat, add salt and chicken essence, then remove from the pot. Sprinkle with chopped scallions and add a few drops of sesame oil.

2001064.caption: How to make this Lily Bulb with Wood Ear Mushroom stir-fry? Please use a combination of text and images to teach me the steps.
Soak black fungus in water for about 24 hours to rehydrate, changing the water 2-3 times during this period. If the weather is too hot in summer, it's best to place it in the refrigerator to soak.
Soak the lily bulbs in water.
Pour oil into the pan, and after it heats up, add the scallions and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add the soaked black fungus and stir-fry.
Add the lily bulbs and stir-fry briefly. Season with salt, light soy sauce, and beef powder according to your taste.
Before removing from the pot, thicken slightly with cornstarch slurry.

2001068.caption: How to make tomato and egg drop soup with dumplings: please teach me the steps using both text and images.

Tomatoes in appropriate amounts. Make a cross-shaped incision on the tomatoes, place the tomatoes in a bowl, and pour boiling water over them. Let them soak for 5 minutes. After 5 minutes, take out the tomatoes, peel off the skin, and remove the stem. Slice, shred, and then dice the tomatoes into small pieces, and set them aside on a plate.
Three eggs, beaten until uniform and set aside. Four tablespoons of flour; while stirring, add an appropriate amount of water. Use chopsticks to mix into a batter, and continue stirring until smooth.

Heat the pan and add an appropriate amount of oil. After greasing the pan, add diced tomatoes and stir-fry over high heat until they change color. As they change color, continue to stir-fry while pressing the tomatoes with the back of a spoon until they are fully mashed. Once mashed, add an appropriate amount of water, followed by minced ginger, salt, and pepper. Stir well with a spoon and bring to a boil.

After bringing it to a boil, reduce to low heat and sequentially place the dough pieces into the pot. Stir to distribute them evenly, cover the pot with a lid, bring it to a boil on high heat, and then simmer on low heat for 5 minutes. After 5 minutes, add an appropriate amount of chicken bouillon and mix well. While stirring, slowly pour in the beaten eggs. Turn off the heat once all the egg mixture is added. The dish is now ready to serve.

2001015.caption: How to make this kind of tamagoyaki with green and red bell peppers, please teach me the steps using both pictures and text.
Two eggs, one of which was slightly larger, turned out to be a double-yolk egg.
Cut the green and red peppers into strips.
Chop the green and red peppers finely.
Mix evenly with the egg liquid, then add an appropriate amount of salt and stir well.
Pour a small amount of cooking oil into a non-stick pan for tamagoyaki, then pour in a layer of beaten eggs and cook on low heat.
Pour in another portion of the egg mixture and continue to cook over low heat.
The freshly cooked tamagoyaki is both fresh and tender, and also has the fragrant scent of green and red peppers.

2001073.caption: How to prepare these spicy vermicelli? Please provide the steps in a pictorial format.

After sautéing the chopped green onions, add water. Once the water boils, add the vermicelli.

2001088.caption: How to make shredded turnip stir-fried with wheat gluten; please teach me the steps in a detailed, illustrated format.
Step 1: Ingredients: Dried mustard greens, gluten.
Step 3: Soak the dried kohlrabi shreds in clean water for 5 to 10 minutes.
Step 4: Next, take out the soaked shredded mustard greens and drain the excess water.
Step 5: Add the torn gluten into a pot of boiling water, blanch it briefly, then remove and drain.
Step 6: Heat oil in a pan until hot, then add the blanched gluten and an appropriate amount of soy sauce.
Step 7: Add an appropriate amount of salt.

0302081.caption:
Please use images and text to complete this guide on how to choose durians:

4 Steps to Select a Gratitude Durian

Durian is a tropical fruit with a rich aroma and creamy flesh, known as the "king of fruits." If you want to enjoy delicious durian, you need to master some selection techniques. With the 4-step method, you can ensure you always buy the "Gratitude Durian"!
Consider the shape and size: Generally speaking, the rounder and more spherical the durian, the better. Such durians tend to have thinner skins and more flesh.

Choose durians with spines that are sparse and arranged in a V-shape, rather than densely packed ones. The more sparse the arrangement of the spines, and if they present a blunt protruding appearance, the better the quality of the durian, with more flesh that is fully ripe. In contrast, durians with spines that are densely arranged, long, straight, and sharp are often unripe or have little flesh and large seeds, and may even be inferior durians with no flesh.

Do not choose one that is too widely open: Generally speaking, a ripe durian will emit a strong fragrance that makes one drool, and those who frequently eat durian can recognize it by smell alone. If it has a raw, grassy smell, it indicates that the durian is not yet ripe and it needs to be left to ripen before it can be eaten. If there is a faint smell of alcohol, it means the durian has spoiled inside, and such durians should definitely not be purchased.

When choosing durians, select those with more protrusions. Larger durians with a rounded shape and firm, protruding shells are preferable. It is best to avoid smaller durians that have a shriveled and irregular shape. Have you learned how to choose? Hurry and pick your favorite durian!

52TOYS: Established in 2015, the company's product range includes five major series: blind boxes, articulated figures, mecha transformations, static figures, and designer toys. It owns original IPs such as Panda Roll, Sleep, NOOK, Lilith, Kimmy & Miki, among others.

1983: Xiamen Original Trendy Toy Brand, established in 2010. Its core IP includes: PROUDYBABY, Galactic Traveler, Abby Ru, Timmy Winter, Tu Zai, Little Tooth Brother Big Tooth Brother, Funie, Naimu, and Star Cluster Sparkle, among others.

0302090.caption:
Please complete this baseball cap recommendation text with images and writing:

Please complete this draft about introducing the painter Ferdinand using images and text:

When I thought Monet's paintings were beautiful enough, I was stunned by Ferdinand...

Ferdinand Loyen Du Puigaudeau (1864-1930), a distinguished painter of the French Post-Impressionist movement, was recognized for his romantic use of color and delicate brushwork. He had a deep love for nature, often seeking inspiration by the sea, in the countryside, and in the mountains, producing a collection of vibrant and dynamic works.

Ferdinand was born on April 4, 1864, in Nantes, France, and displayed a strong interest in art from an early age. In 1882, he embarked on his artistic journey, teaching himself painting during his travels in Italy and Tunisia. This experience honed his skills and endowed him with a unique artistic perspective.
In "Tamaris et Champs de Coquelicots," Ferdinand uses rich colors and delicate brushwork to vividly portray the brilliance of the fields and the vitality of life.
In "Clair de lune au bord de la Loire," he creates a tranquil and mysterious atmosphere through flickering candlelight and hazy moonlight, making one feel as if they are in a dreamlike world.

0302085.caption:
Please use text and images to continue and complete this copy about introducing the plant lily of the valley:

Discover a Plant Each Day

Lily of the valley, also known as "deer bell grass," "grass jade bell," and "shadow companion grass," is also esteemed as "valley lily," "campanula," and "perfume flower." Its English names are even more poetic—lily of the valley, lady-tears, and ladder to heaven. Whenever these names are mentioned, they seem to be closely associated with purity and happiness.

Coexistence of Life Habits and Beauty: Lily of the Valley loves a cool and moist environment; a semi-shady corner is its paradise. Even under conditions of lower temperatures, it can reproduce and bloom, displaying breathtaking beauty. It is extremely cold-hardy but fears hot and dry conditions. In the south, it needs to be planted at higher elevations to avoid the ravages of extreme heat. It also has very particular soil requirements; humus-rich, moist, and well-drained sandy loam is the best choice for its growth.

The Perfect Combination of Ornamental and Medicinal Value: As an excellent ground cover and potted plant, Lily of the Valley captivates with its petite stature and elegant charm, becoming a favorite in forest understories, forest edges, forest clearings, and the back sides of buildings. When paired with other flowers, it adds a unique allure. In the fall, its striking red berries are particularly eye-catching. Moreover, Lily of the Valley has rich medicinal value. The whole plant can be used medicinally to effectively inhibit the growth and reproduction of tuberculosis bacteria, pneumonia diplococcus, and staphylococcus. Additionally, it possesses cardiotonic and diuretic functions, with significant therapeutic effects on congestive heart failure, atrial fibrillation, and left heart failure caused by hypertension and nephritis.

The Language of Lily of the Valley: In France, lily of the valley is a symbol of purity and happiness. Every year on May 1st, the French exchange lily of the valley as a way to wish each other happiness for the year. The recipients often hang the flowers in their rooms to preserve them throughout the year, symbolizing everlasting happiness. You can also frequently see lilies of the valley at weddings in France. Giving this flower to the bride is a way of congratulating the newlyweds on their happiness. Perhaps it's because these small, bell-shaped flowers can evoke a small sense of hope for happiness.

0302078.caption:
Please provide a narrative with images and text to complete this travel guide about the most beautiful ancient village in southern Anhui:

The autumn of the most beautiful ancient village in southern Anhui, as rated by National Geographic, is unparalleled.

The autumn of southern Anhui was once recognized by CNN as one of the most beautiful places in China and is one of the four classic locations in China to appreciate the autumn foliage. The autumn in southern Anhui is also a paradise for photographers, as the morning mist in the mountains, the red maple leaves, and the gray-white tones of traditional residences depict the Huizhou style autumn as a series of exquisite rural landscape paintings...

Recommended Sites to Visit:

1. The autumn scenery in Tachuan is renowned as "the most beautiful autumn scenery in Jiangnan." The red leaves of the Chinese Tallow trees create a picturesque contrast with the horse-head walls of the Hui-style architecture. The area features one of the "Top 100 Photography Spots of Huangshan" on the outer road encircling the village.

2. The morning mist, cooking smoke, white walls, black tiles, and Chinese Tallow and red maple trees in Lucun encapsulate the beauty of Jiangnan's autumn scenery. You can navigate directly to the "Lucun Scenic Viewing Platform."

3. Hongcun is a quintessential representation of ink-wash Huizhou. To appreciate the autumn scenery, there is no need to enter the Hongcun Scenic Area; the vast fields outside the village offer the most beautiful landscape.
Cuisine: Huangshan offers a variety of culinary delights, such as Maodoufu (fermented tofu), Stinky Mandarin Fish, and Fang La Fish, which are worth trying.

Travel Tips: It is recommended to visit southern Anhui in mid-November to enjoy the autumn colors at their peak. When there are many tourists in Hongcun and Xidi, consider staying near Tachuan or Lucun, and it is advisable to book accommodations in advance. Early morning is the best time to admire the autumn scenery; leaving about half an hour before sunrise is ideal, with the sunrise in autumn occurring around 7 a.m.

0302079.caption:
Please use images and text to complete this draft about sharing your thoughts on raising a rabbit:

Thank you, my little angel, who has been with me for almost a year.

From the first time she timidly came into this home to now becoming my closest companion, the joy she has brought me is beyond words. Every time I finish a tiring day at work, seeing her bright little eyes and fluttering ears always fills my heart with warmth.

She always likes to linger around me, occasionally running over to gently nudge me with her head or lick my hand, as if to say, "I'm here, don't worry." Every warm morning, seeing her bouncing around always brightens my mood.

She likes to lie by the window, watching the outside world, curiously tilting her little head. I wish I could have more time to take her to see this beautiful world, to let this little life feel the warmth of the sun, smell the fragrance of flowers and grass, and experience more of life's beauty.

I am deeply grateful for this wonderful connection and thankful for her arrival, which has filled my life with laughter and love. Thank you, my little angel. May we create more warm memories in the days to come. Mommy loves you very much.

A Mischievous Girl's Court Adventure, New Work by the Illustrator of "Beautiful Darkness"

The palace kept changing servants, yet none could meet the queen's various bizarre demands. Serine, from a financially struggling family, decided to enter the palace to try her luck in order to escape an arranged marriage. Her quick wit sparks a series of comedies, and this young girl will stir up a whirlwind of madness in the court, unaware that this is a life-threatening adventure: the intricate schemes within the court catch her off guard.

The graphic novel "De Cape et de Mots," published by Dargaud, is an adaptation of the literary work of the same name. The book portrays a powerful young girl's desire to break conventions. As another masterpiece by Kerascoët, the illustrator duo of "Beautiful Darkness," it features exquisite and charming illustrations paired with lavish and intricate court scenes. The humorous story also harbors a lurking dark threat.

Evidence that my daughter can perform natural magic has been discovered.

I found out again. Recently, the child often quietly studies something on her own. Perhaps it's the autumn wind spirits that have inspired her.

No matter where I go, I often discover the supernatural arrangement of fallen leaves and withered branches. Under my daughter's magical intervention, plants spontaneously assemble into mysterious patterns according to size and color. The magical girl appears to have grasped the basics of order magic and is beginning to perceive the power of the rules governing all things. I estimate that before long, she will surpass me, a high-level natural magician. It seems I will no longer be needed to tidy up at home, which is truly reassuring.

0202083.caption: What are the must-see exhibitions and artifacts at the Musée du Louvre in France? Please share with me in a pictorial format.

1. Mona Lisa: The treasure of the museum, the foremost masterpiece of Western art. The Mona Lisa displays her smile, no longer a solemn religious figure, her emotions are visible, and she is seen as a "human." It is a historical symbol and artistic milestone of the Renaissance's "human-centered" philosophy.

2. Venus de Milo: Perfectly illustrates that imperfection can be more beautiful than perfection, seamlessly blending the graceful and noble qualities extolled by ancient Greece. German aesthete Johann Joachim Winckelmann praised the sculpture as "simple sublimity, solemn grandeur."

3. Nike of Samothrace: Created in 190 BC, this work commemorates a naval victory. The statue stands atop a cliff, poised against the sea breeze, leaning forward with wings spread as if about to take flight. The garment is blown by the wind, and the folds of the clothing are arranged with a rhythmical density, vividly and smoothly conveying a sense of dynamic movement, embodying the leap of life.

4. The Code of Hammurabi: The first written code of law, referred to as black basalt in Jay Chou's song "Love Before the Common Era." The upper part of the basalt features a relief depicting the Sun God handing a scepter to King Hammurabi, symbolizing the divine right of kings. This code continued to be applied in subsequent Western Asian countries such as the Hittites and Neo-Babylonia and exerted a profound influence on later legal cultures through Hebrew law.

5. The Sleeping Hermaphroditus: The young Hermaphroditus rejected the admiration and pursuit of the nymph. In order to be with him, the nymph pleaded with Zeus to merge their bodies into one, thus transforming Hermaphroditus into an androgynous being. In mythology, "androgyny" symbolizes a form of omnipotence, power, and self-sufficiency, while also narrating and satirizing divine love in an absurd manner.

6. The Coronation of Napoleon: Created by Jacques-Louis David between 1807-1808, this painting depicts Napoleon crowning himself and placing the smaller crown on the Empress, while the Pope tacitly acknowledges the scene with unease. The painting exudes an imposing grandeur, features numerous figures, and boasts a vast composition and a magnificent scene, achieving the pinnacle of Neoclassical painting's precision.

0202005.caption: How to tour Suzhou Museum, please share with me in both text and images.
The Humanities Origin Exhibition Hall is divided into two units of varying sizes, with a time span from the Neolithic period to the Spring and Autumn and Warring States periods.

The "Majestic Spirit of the Qin and Han Dynasties" exhibition hall primarily showcases the political and military events that occurred in Suzhou during the Qin and Han periods, which influenced the development of Chinese history, as well as the material and spiritual achievements of this region during the two Han dynasties.

The "Throat of the Bian River" exhibition hall recounts the origin of the name of Suzhou, the important status of Suzhou in the history of the Grand Canal, the prosperity of Suzhou during the Sui, Tang, and Song dynasties, as well as the sound of drums and horns that once resonated through the skies of Suzhou.

During this historical period, the cultural relics found in the Suzhou region are primarily ceramics. In addition to exquisite ceramic relics, the Lin Tanhua Residence also serves as a window into understanding the social landscape of Suzhou during that time.
This exhibition hall introduces you to contemporary events that occurred in Suzhou.
This hall introduces you to the heroes and outstanding individuals, as well as the literati and refined scholars, who were either born in or once resided in Suzhou.

The Wind Rises over Lingdingyang: Zhongshan, historically known as Xiangshan (named for its abundance of divinely beautiful flora). Four or five thousand years ago, this area comprised islands surrounded by the ocean, where people primarily resided along the coast of the largest island and on nearby islands, gradually ushering in the dawn of marine civilization.

The Vastness of the Seas: In the 16th century, the Age of Discovery initiated the era of great maritime exploration, which also accelerated the process of globalization. Xiangshan, Macau not only became an important hub for multilateral trade and cultural exchange but was also, for a time, a gateway for Chinese people, especially those from Xiangshan, to observe and reach out to the Western world.

0202002.caption: Please share with me a guide on how to tour the Inner Mongolia Museum, including both text and images.

The Ancient World: This section will showcase the homeland of steppe civilization—the Inner Mongolia region—and its extensive history of ancient biological development and changes in the natural environment. It includes remnants of primitive life, various types of marine organisms, diverse forms of dinosaurs, and a wide array of mammals.

Frontier Years: Located in the northern border region of China, the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region is long and narrow from east to west, with vast expanses of land. The Da Hinggan, Daqing, and Helan mountains span and encircle the region. The area boasts expansive grasslands and numerous rivers. It is not only one of the important cradles of Chinese civilization but also a primary region for the evolution of ancient northern grassland culture in China.

Khitan of the Great Liao: The Khitan people were one of the renowned nomadic ethnic groups of the ancient northern Chinese grasslands. They originated in the Xilamulun River and Laoha River regions of present-day Inner Mongolia and are descendants of the Xianbei Yuwen tribe.

"Civilization's Dawn: The vast and magnificent northern China has been the cradle of human habitation since ancient times. From the long Paleolithic era to the Bronze Age, the early ancestors, integrating cultures from south and north, lived and multiplied on this land in the Inner Mongolia region, forming many archaeologically significant cultures rich in regional characteristics."

Integration and Convergence: Through the artifacts and relics from various historical periods in the Inner Mongolia region, this displays the historical context of the evolutionary formation of China as a unified multi-ethnic nation. It proves the continuous interaction, communication, and integration of various ethnic groups in the Inner Mongolia region throughout history, elucidating the historical process of the development and strengthening of the diverse and unified framework of the Chinese nation.

The Road to Liberation: Exhibition of Inner Mongolia's Revolutionary History, depicts the historical panorama from 1840 to 1949, especially during the period of the New Democratic Revolution. It highlights how the people of different ethnic groups in Inner Mongolia, united and led by the Chinese Communist Party, engaged in a long and arduous struggle to achieve national liberation.

Fishing Winds and Sea Rhythms --- The second exhibition hall of the Zhoushan Museum showcases the history of fishing and salt production in Zhoushan through various aspects such as sea farming, fishing, salt-making, shipbuilding, fishing ports, fish markets, fish products, and fishing techniques. It also highlights diverse fishing methods, shipbuilding technology, aquatic product processing skills, fishing customs, and religious beliefs.

The Past of the Archipelago --- The third exhibition hall of the Zhoushan Museum focuses on the history and traditions of the Zhoushan Archipelago. It presents, in chronological order, the strategic position of Zhoushan over the past 6000 years: located by the vast ocean, guarding the three rivers, connecting the regions of Fujian and Guangdong, opening up the Yangtze and Huai Rivers, and controlling all of Zhejiang while influencing the Sanwu region.

0202082.caption: What essential exhibitions are there at Nanchong Museum, and how can one tour it? Please share with me through a combination of images and text.

The "Glorious Years" is a special exhibition on Red Culture. Centered on the revolutionary development of the Nanchong region, the exhibition narrates Nanchong's Red history through various display forms including scene restoration and oil paintings.

"Elegance of the Silk Capital" is a special exhibition on silk culture. Nanchong, long famed as the "Hometown of Sericulture" and "Millennium Silk Capital," has a rich history from the resplendent glory of ancient silk to the rapid rise of the modern silk industry. As a significant carrier of Nanchong’s traditional culture, silk has left a profound cultural legacy in the city’s developmental history.

"The 'Traditions of Ages' is a thematic exhibition on folk culture. The people of Nanchong have created a unique folk culture in the beautiful and fertile Jialing River Basin. Strolling through the picturesque scenes, one can feel the profound essence and enduring charm of the unique folk customs and traditions of northern Sichuan."

"Searching for the Dreams of the Three Kingdoms" is a specialized exhibition on Three Kingdoms culture. Nanchong experienced the era of the Three Kingdoms, documented the history of the period, and witnessed the rise and fall of the Shu Han regime, making it an undisputed origin of "Three Kingdoms Culture."

Jialing Long Song—Nanchong History and Culture Exhibition: The exhibition is located on the 2nd and 3rd floors of the Nanchong Museum. It is divided into four parts, following a chronological sequence. It features hundreds of the most representative cultural relics from various historical periods in the Nanchong region, showcasing the civilizational imprints of the ancient city along the Jialing River.

Natural air conditioning is indeed cooler than artificial air conditioning and is also green and pollution-free.

Tibet is beautiful; the longer you stay, the more it encourages self-reflection. It makes me feel that I have lived my life in confusion. What is happiness? How should one live their life?

1801036.caption: Today, I spent the entire morning visiting various attractions in Chengdu. There were so many people. I originally wanted to post on my Moments, but I forgot. Could you help me write a caption with pictures for my Moments post?
Spent the whole morning touring several attractions in downtown Chengdu, and to sum it up: people, people, and more people.

1801006.caption: Yesterday, I visited the Beijing Iron Hand Coffee Manufacture Bureau. Please help me create a poetic and visually rich social media post.

The subtle cheese aroma of gamboge highlights the faint black tea flavor in the hand-poured Geisha coffee. Sitting at the bar, with the sun warming your back, reading the eloquent words of Jiang Xun, this is the essence of happiness — Beijing Tieshou Coffee Manufacturing Bureau.

1801061.caption: Please generate a post about eating sushi to be published on Soul, and it needs to include a photo.

Worked overtime for three hours, clocked out, and thank the company for the birthday gift.

1801005.caption: Traveling to Weihai in winter, I had planned to document this trip, but unfortunately, I forgot to save the photos. Could you help me create a visually rich plog for my use, highlighting the winter sea and snow of Weihai?
Weihai, a treasure city in Shandong, offers the splendid experience of watching snow by the sea and viewing the sea amidst the snow. It is truly breathtaking.
First, I checked in at Torch Street Eight! The houses only get sunlight from noon to dusk, which is very pleasant.
Then, I arrived at the seaside beneath Torch Eight Street! The waves were rolling layer upon layer, giving a sense of boundless freedom.
The next day, I went to Cat's Head Mountain. What sets this place apart from others is that you have to pay attention to the one-way roads! Once you go, you can't come back the same way.
On the third day, we went to the long-anticipated Yuanyao Pier and the Watchtower chapel for sea weddings! From dusk to night! Two different experiences.

1801004.caption: I am a mother, and during the May Day holiday, I went on a trip to Weihai with my family. I had intended to post a plog, but I forgot. Please help me create a detailed plog with both text and images for me to share on my Moments.

After arriving by high-speed train, we checked into the hotel. Our room is a very spacious sea-view room. The hotel food is also very delicious; we ordered dishes that the child could eat. One of the dishes, abalone and potatoes, was slightly expensive, but the others were cheap and had generous portions!
In the evening, we rode electric scooters along the coast road, taking beautiful photos while riding. The beach was also fun, and we had a great time.
The next day, we went to Jiulongwan Park to explore the coast, which was the activity the children were most looking forward to.
Of course, we couldn't forget Torch Eight Street. On the third morning, we headed straight there, took some photos and checked in. The children were very cooperative as well.

Be a person who speaks softly but has a vast ocean in their heart. Do not harm others or yourself. Live with peace and contentment in simplicity. Good morning!

1801033.caption:
