0301070.caption: Please complete the subsequent parts of the story with images and text based on the given opening parts.One sunny day in the playful world of the Rabbids, a curious Rabbid found an old radio on a playground swing, excited to explore its buttons and features.
Meanwhile, another Rabbid was tinkering with a peculiar machine next to a yellow school bus. This machine was no ordinary device; it was a wacky invention that could change the weather!
Outside, the machine's effects became visible as the sky turned a deep shade of purple. The Rabbids, unaware of the chaos they had caused, continued to play around with the buttons and levers.

Inside the machine, the curious Rabbids found a panel with mysterious symbols and a big red button. Unable to resist, one of the Rabbids pushed the button, not knowing that it would activate the machine even further!
The machine's power surged, and suddenly, the Rabbids were looking at another Rabbid through a small window in the machine, making silly faces at each other.

The weather machine, now out of control, started changing the seasons rapidly. Snow began to fall, and the temperature dropped. The playful Rabbids, dressed in their summer gear, were suddenly in a winter wonderland.

Finally, after much pressing and prodding, the Rabbids managed to turn off the machine. The weather began to slowly return to normal, and they all laughed at the crazy adventure. They decided to keep the machine safe, promising only to use it with care in the future—or maybe just for more fun on another day!

0301067.caption: Please complete the subsequent parts of the story with images and text based on the given opening parts.In the world of the Rabbids, a peculiar room with teal walls and geometric patterns was the stage for today's adventure. The Rabbids, always curious and mischievous, found themselves in a room with a mysterious white board and a large mirror framed with yellow and black stripes.

As they explored, one Rabbid stumbled upon a strange helmet with wires and gadgets attached. It was no ordinary helmet; it had blinking lights and seemed to hum with energy. The Rabbid, unable to resist, put the helmet on, and suddenly, its eyes widened with wonder!

Amid the fun, the helmet seemed to glitch. The Rabbid wearing it tapped its head, puzzled by the flickering lights. It started to think harder, trying to control the chaotic creations spawned by its thoughts.
The helmet was no ordinary headgear; it was a mind-reading device! As the Rabbid thought about various things, the helmet translated its thoughts into visible holograms.

First, the helmet-wearing Rabbid had another thought, and a giant basketball appeared! The Rabbids were astonished and jumped around the huge ball, trying to climb it and roll it around, turning the room into their playground.

The helmet, now overheating, began to spark a little. Concerned, the other Rabbids gathered around, trying to figure out how to remove it. They pulled and tugged, but the helmet was stuck! Exhausted from the day's adventures, the Rabbids settled down. They looked at the helmet, becoming quiet and harmless on the head. They learned that some toys might be too tricky to play with, but teamwork and friendship can solve even the most puzzling challenges.

0301040.caption: Please help me continue this story with images and text.Sometimes when you're unable to communicate with others it can feel like you're alone!
Communicate can look different for all of us but we can all find a common ground to be able to express ourselves.

One way is to use an iPad with a speaking software on it.
With the help of pictures, you're able to express yourself to others.
Your voice is YOURS! No matter which way you use it! We can call communicate our needs to feel included in the conversation.

0301096.caption: Please complete the subsequent parts of the story with images and text based on the given opening parts.One evening, Curious George was playing outside near his house. The sky was dotted with stars, and everything was peaceful.
Suddenly, George heard a soft thumping sound coming from the yellow birdhouse hanging on the tree. Curious as always, he decided to investigate.
George peeked into the birdhouse and saw something moving inside. He couldn't tell what it was, so he reached in with his little hand.
To his surprise, he imagined that he found nothing but dirt in the birdhouse.
George cleaned the dirt in the birdhouse to make it a comfortable home for his friend Bird.

0301095.caption: Please complete the subsequent parts of the story with images and text based on the given opening parts.One sunny day, George the curious little monkey was at a fair with his friend in a pink blouse and blue skirt. She was happily explaining something about the fair, gesturing with her hands.
Next, they stopped by a parade where many people were gathered. There was a man in a red uniform, a chef, and others all watching something exciting. George was curious about what was happening.
They moved on to a quieter part of the fair where an artist was about to reveal a beautiful painting. Everyone was eagerly waiting, and George sneaked backstage behind the blue curtains and peeked.
It was a colorful array of stars and stripes behind the blue curtain. George was fascinated and reached out to touch the bright stars, wondering how they felt.

0301046.caption: Once upon a time, in the magical land of dinosaurs, two large dinosaurs, one light green and the other dark blue, were having a chat. They were standing in a beautiful field, discussing the mysteries of their world.
Soon, they were joined by a group of their dinosaur friends. They all stood together, sharing stories of their adventures and enjoying each other's company.

This group of baby dinos of various species stands together in the grassy area nearby. They were a colorful bunch, with a Diplodocus, an Apatosaurus, a T-Rex, a Pteranodon, a Stegosaurus, a Brachiosaurus, and a Triceratops. They seemed to be playing a game, oblivious to the world around them.
One of the baby dinos, a small one with a big heart, looked up at a larger dinosaur who was smiling down at it. The larger dinosaur was telling the little one a story about the old times.

In the meantime, a small dinosaur with a long neck and big eyes was having a conversation with an alligator who had a long neck and a mustache. They were both looking up at a large green alligator who was telling them a funny joke. A small dodo, wearing a blue jacket and a yellow hat with a red feather, was listening in on their conversation.
Meanwhile, a young T-Rex named Littlefoot was gazing at a large blue dinosaur with red eyes. The dinosaur was telling tales of the great beyond, and Littlefoot was captivated by every word.
Later, the group of dinosaurs came across a group of long-necked blue dinosaurs standing in front of a large rock formation. They were in awe of the beautiful sight.

0301061.caption: Please complete the subsequent parts of the story with images and text based on the given opening parts.Once upon a time, in a dense, stormy jungle, a group of dinosaur friends gathered. Among them were a baby dinosaur, an adult Triceratops, an adult Stegosaurus, a flying Pteranodon, and a curious Dilophosaurus. They were all gathered around a large rock, discussing their plans for the day.

Later, they found themselves in front of the cave. THe adult Triceratops go through it first. The other dinosaurs, all different sizes, colors, and shapes, stood in a line, ready for an exciting adventure.

On the beginning of their journey, two small dinosaurs, a brown one and a purple one, paused next to a tree. The brown dinosaur seemed to be about to speak, while the purple one looked up, shouting out a warning.

A baby dinosaur with a green shell and red hair looked up at a larger red dinosaur. The larger dinosaur, with its long neck, smiled down at the baby dinosaur. They were both standing on a rock, bonding in the jungle setting.
Soon, they were joined by other baby dinosaurs, including an orange one and a purple one. They were all excited about the adventure they were about to embark on.

0301098.caption: Please complete the subsequent parts of the story with images and text based on the given opening parts.One starry night, George the curious monkey stood outside, pondering the vast sky. He wondered about the stars and the moon, and what secrets they held.
Suddenly, a brilliant idea popped into his head! George imagined flying among the birds, soaring high above the trees and clouds.
The next morning, George found a big blue bird in a nest near his house. He was fascinated by its bright feathers and gentle eyes.
George noticed the bird is crying. Worried about the safety of the bird, he decided to help.
Carefully, George climbed up a stack of logs, reaching the nest to check on the bird. He made sure that everything was alright.
To his surprise, George found a little mouse near the nest. The mouse was friendly and playful, and George was delighted to have another animal friend.
The bird, grateful for George's concern, flapped its wings joyously. George felt proud to help and protect his new friends.
In the end, George learned that even a small act of kindness can make a big difference. He promised to always look out for his friends in the sky and on the ground.

0301085.caption: Please complete the subsequent parts of the story with images and text based on the given opening parts.George felt a bit chilly and thought a warm bath would be nice. He filled the tub with water and lots of bubbly soap, creating a frothy sea for his bath-time adventure.
As George settled into the bubbles, he heard footsteps approaching. It was the man in the yellow hat, peeking in to check on him.
George smiled and splashed around, showing how much fun he was having. The man in the yellow hat laughed and reminded George not to splash too much water out of the tub.
Suddenly, George noticed something green and small hopping near the tub. It was a tiny frog! George was delighted and watched the frog curiously.
The frog jumped into the tub with George, and they started playing together. George was careful not to let the frog slip under the bubbles.
The man in the yellow hat saw the frog. He gently explained to George that frogs are friends and need to live in their natural home, not in bathtubs.
George understood and, with a little help, carefully caught the frog. He was ready to take it back to the garden where it belonged.

0201015.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with a 3-day, 2-night travel guide for Qinhuangdao.
Accommodation: It is recommended to stay near Maoye Tiandi. There are many guesthouses, and it's located in the city center, making dining, shopping, and transportation very convenient.

Travel Itinerary  
Day 1  
Le Island Ocean Kingdom ➡️ Evening at Jinmeng Bay, Check-in at the Internet-famous Smile Wall ➡️ Night at Qinhuang Alley  

Le Island Ocean Kingdom: A one-stop marine-themed park where you can see dolphins, seals, sea lions, and belugas. The purple beach is breathtakingly beautiful.  

Jinmeng Bay: The seaside features a romantic restaurant and an Internet-famous photo wall that's Instagram-worthy from any angle. A small island hosts the world with a smile.  

Qinhuang Alley: A hidden gem of a snack street offering a variety of delicious treats. It's perfect for both eating and shopping, but be prepared for crowds.

Day 2  
Yutian Qili Sea ➡️ Sand Dune Art Museum  
Yutian Qili Sea features various small animals: giraffes, capybaras, water buffaloes, and an animal Broadway~ In the evening, you can also see seven-colored clouds and fireworks.  
Sand Dune Art Museum in Anaya, with the theme "Birdhead: Clouds ☁️".

Day 3  
Yudao ➡️ In the Groove, a popular internet-famous café  
Yudao is a 10-minute drive from Anaya.  
In the Groove  
Due to the tight schedule of three days and two nights, those with more time can enjoy another day, as both Zuoyou Valley/Biluota/Nanyue are great for fun and photography.

0201011.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a few interesting and lesser-known cities in Yunnan that are must-visit destinations!
Mile: A city abundant in sunshine, warm in winter and cool in summer, featuring hot springs and fine wine, with flowers visible everywhere, offering warmth and healing for the soul.
Tengchong: A small town resembling a fairyland, with mild climate, volcanic geothermal landscapes, and over 60 hot springs, praised by Xu Xiake as the "first town on the frontier."

Pu'er: The only city in Yunnan that borders three countries. It is not highly commercialized and is rich in ancient charm. You can visit ancient villages and tea mountains. Besides tea, there are also many unique local delicacies.

Ruili: It is over 100 kilometers from Mangshi to Ruili, and you can visit both places together. Ruili is a border city adjacent to Laos and Myanmar. Unique landscapes include forests formed by single trees and a village divided between two countries, while the area is rich in ethnic customs and traditions.

Mengzi: Filming location of the movie "Youth," the birthplace of "Crossing the Bridge" rice noodles, the capital of Honghe Prefecture, and an important site of the Yunnan-Vietnam Railway. It is also celebrated as the "hometown of pomegranates," rich with a sense of history and the passage of time, making it a must-visit destination for literary and artistic youths.
Yuxi: Boasting magnificent natural landscapes and a rich array of local cuisine, the must-try dish is copper pot fish. It also preserves some ancient towns and cultural heritages with a long history.

Jianshui: In the ancient town of Jianshui in Yunnan, one can explore ancient villages and bridges scattered across the countryside, tranquil and peaceful old town streets, and a variety of distinctive local delicacies.

Puzhehei: Known as the "Little Guilin of Yunnan," Puzhehei boasts over 80 large and small karst caves. The caves are interconnected by water, allowing boats to traverse through them, revealing a dazzling array of stalactites, stalagmites, and stone pillars that are vibrant, colorful, and crystal clear. Additionally, lotus flowers are abundant, creating a picturesque landscape of mountains, water, and cultural gardens.

0201041.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with an essential itinerary for a one-day tour of Paris.

The most famous landmark in this city is Notre-Dame Cathedral, which is also the starting point of our day tour today. Notre-Dame Cathedral → Louvre Museum → Michelin Star Restaurant → Tuileries Garden → Champs-Élysées → Arc de Triomphe → Seine River → Eiffel Tower.

Notre-Dame Cathedral

Admission: Free

Visiting Hours: Currently under renovation, expected to reopen in December 2024.

To avoid the crowds, you should arrive at Notre-Dame Cathedral by 8:30 in the morning. This building, now 850 years old, is the world's first fully Gothic-style cathedral. The artistic value of the building itself, along with the art masterpieces displayed within, have made it renowned worldwide.

Louvre Museum  
Ticket: €17  
Visiting Hours: Monday, Thursday, Saturday, Sunday from 9:00 to 18:00; Wednesday, Friday from 9:00 to 21:45; Closed on Tuesday  
By taking Metro Line 7, you can arrive at the Louvre at 10:00. The palace itself is a work of art, and its Denon Wing, Sully Wing, and Richelieu Wing house world-class paintings, sculptures, and royal collections respectively.

Michelin Restaurant  
Admission: Free  
Duration: All day  
After concluding a morning of "art appreciation," a five-minute walk leads to this Michelin restaurant, where the fresh dishes are truly mouthwatering.

Tuileries Garden  
Admission: Free  
Opening hours: 7:00 AM - 9:00 PM  
After having a hearty meal, cross the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel to arrive at the Tuileries Garden. Here, the fusion of nature and art makes one feel relaxed and at ease.

Champs-Élysées  
Ticket: Free  
Opening Hours: All day  
After passing through Place de la Concorde, the Champs-Élysées comes into view. This street features Paris's most high-end fashion and accessories and is the ultimate destination for those in the fashion industry.

Arc de Triomphe  
Ticket: 13 Euros  
Visiting Hours: 7:00-21:00  

Walk to the end of the Champs-Élysées to ascend the Arc de Triomphe, where the star-shaped radiating streets of the Champs-Élysées strike at the soul. If you wait until sunset, when the lights start to illuminate everywhere, it becomes an absolutely stunning scene.

Seine River  
Tickets: Free  
Visiting Hours: All day  
The Seine River, as sung about in songs, is right in Paris. Having a romantic dinner by the Seine River in the evening is certainly the best French date along the Seine.

Eiffel Tower  
Tickets: Free  
Visiting Hours: 7:00 AM - 9:00 PM  
The illuminated Eiffel Tower will certainly make you feel that your visit was worthwhile, and reaching the top of the tower provides you with a bird's-eye view of the entire city.

0201003.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a few must-visit treasures for someone coming to Zhengzhou for the first time.

Henan Museum: A segment of Chinese history, half of which is the history of Henan! It's a must-visit museum every time you come to Zhengzhou, with a vast collection of artifacts. Among them, the nine must-see treasures of the museum are:

1. Jiahu Bone Flute (Exhibition Hall 1, Floor 1)
2. Beast-Face Decorated Square Bronze Ding (Exhibition Hall 2, Floor 1)
3. Owl-Shaped Zun of Lady Hao (Exhibition Hall 2, Floor 1)
4. Jade-Handed Iron Sword (Exhibition Hall 3, Floor 1)
5. Lotus and Crane Square Jar (Exhibition Hall 4, Floor 1)
6. Four Deities and Cloud Design (Exhibition Hall 5, Floor 2)
7. Wu Zetian's Golden Slip (Exhibition Hall 7, Floor 2)
8. Ru Kiln Sky-Blue Glazed Carved Flower Goose-Neck Vase (Exhibition Hall 10, Floor 3)
9. Cloud Patterned Bronze Ban (Exhibition Hall 13, Floor 4)

Visitors can explore on their own, or hire a guide (it is recommended to hire a guide for a deeper understanding). The duration of the visit is approximately 1 to 3 hours. The museum offers a variety of food and cultural products, although the prices are rather high. You might consider purchasing a postcard or envelope.

The new Zhengzhou Science and Technology Museum is truly an excellent place to visit with children during holidays. It's advisable to prepare items like water bottles, small snacks, and light jackets in advance. On the first floor, there is an "Animal Home" exhibit with well-designed scenes and very lifelike animals, providing a rich experience. The second floor features experiments related to optics, mechanics, electromagnetism, chemistry, and more, allowing you to explore and experiment with your child.

Zhengzhou Botanical Garden requires an on-site reservation at the number machine at the entrance of the tropical rainforest. It is recommended to go early, otherwise, it gets extremely crowded, and there will be lines for shooting locations. With fewer people, you can finish shooting in about an hour. The route for shooting locations is as follows: Upon entering, take the stone path by the small waterfall on the left—follow the stone path into the cave for another spot—exit the cave and turn left for the staircase location—the photographer should not move from the top of the stairs, while the model should go to the wooden staircase location below.

0201022.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with a one-day travel itinerary for Florence.

First Stop: Florence Cathedral (taking photos outside is sufficient) 

Tickets for climbing to the top are in high demand and need to be purchased online in advance. However, in my opinion, you can climb to the top of various cathedrals in Europe, which essentially offer a panoramic view of the city, and after visiting many, it can become visually tiring. Therefore, I did not choose to climb to the top. We purchased tickets for the crypt, the baptistery, and the museum. From the crypt, we were able to enter the cathedral directly, which saved us a lot of time waiting in line. Having seen many cathedrals, they no longer hold much novelty for me, and the baptistery and museum seemed even less necessary for me, a casual tourist, to visit. Going inside felt like a quick, superficial tour.

Second Stop: Central Market (Grandma's Pork Tripe Bun)  
This is a food court that is particularly crowded, and securing seats depends entirely on being quick. The Grandma's Pork Tripe Bun recommended by XHS is very delicious, with a spicy kick. The stall is located outside the market, so you need to pay extra attention to find it. It's very popular, and the buns are sold out by noon.

Third Stop: Academy of Fine Arts Museum  
The museum is not large. For art novices, the main attraction is David. After viewing it, you can take a general walk around and then leave.

Station Four: Uzfo Art Museum  
Having traveled all the way from France and visited so many museums and art galleries, I've become quite numb to them, and the number of photos I've taken is visibly decreasing. However, since I'm already here, how could I not take a look?

Fifth stop: Old Bridge  
Visit the location featured in Jay Chou's "What Kind of Man" music video. It's very commercialized; just take a casual look around.

Sixth Stop: Michelangelo Square

Be sure to arrange your timing well in advance for sunset viewing. We couldn't get a taxi or catch a public bus, and ended up missing it entirely. The square is very crowded and lively; buying a bottle of beer and enjoying the night view is also a good experience.

Tips:

1. Be sure to choose accommodation near the train station (Florence Santa Maria Novella). All the attractions are located in this area, making it extremely convenient for travel and saves the hassle of luggage storage.

2. Transportation mostly relies on walking and buses. Buying bus tickets is very convenient on the "at bus" APP, but remember to activate your ticket upon boarding to avoid inspection issues.

3. On the first Sunday of each month, both the Accademia Gallery and the Uffizi Gallery offer free admission, so take advantage if possible.

4. Florence has many interesting small shops worth exploring. Research those that interest you in advance and take the opportunity to visit them.

0201078.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a 3-day 2-night travel itinerary for Beihai.
Day 1: Arrival in Beihai—Liuxia Village—Guantou Ridge—Beihai Qiaogang Customs Street
Day 2: Beihai Old Street - Silver Beach - Stroll and Dine
Day 3: On the last day, feel free to stroll around and buy some small gifts or figurines.

Transportation:
Beihai Fucheng Airport (also reachable by flying to Nanning and transferring to a bullet train to Beihai)
Bullet Train Beihai Station

Tourist Guide:

- Silver Beach: A must-visit attraction in Beihai, known for its pristine white sands.
  
- Beihai Old Street: Perfect for taking photos and enjoying gourmet food.

- Guantou Ridge: Navigate directly to the 'Sea-dried Stone' location for a view of the Beihai sunset.

- Qiaogang Fengqing Street: Indulge in a variety of delicious snacks and foods.

- Weizhou Island: The youngest volcanic island in China, often referred to as the "Island of Penglai."

- Liuxia Village: A village out of a Hayao Miyazaki manga.

- Mangrove Forest: A great place for interesting interactions, suitable for visiting with a partner or children.

Accommodation  
If you're just going to Silver Beach for a short visit, stay in Haicheng District. Beihai itself is not very large, so if your budget allows, you can opt for a sea-view room at Fuli Hua or Shangri-La; these are the most expensive options, but offer excellent sea views. If your budget is limited but you still want a sea view, consider the Lanting Sea View Hotel. Staying in the city center does not provide sea views, so accommodation depends on personal preference. For family trips, you can choose a family suite at a homestay.  

On Weizhou Island, accommodation during holidays is tight, and the island itself is not large, so no specific recommendations are made. If you cannot accept the premium pricing for accommodation on the island, it is advised not to visit during holidays.

0201060.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a few attractions in Helsingør, Denmark.

Kronborg Castle is an absolute must-visit place for everyone. Tickets for two can be purchased online for 280 kroner.

A few suggestions:

1. Arrive at 10 AM. Enter as soon as the castle opens, so you can take great photos and explore while it's not crowded.

2. Join the 10:30 AM English guided tour. It’s free and lasts only 15 minutes. This will give you a general understanding of the castle's history, and you can also hear some gossip about the king and queen.

3. Stroll around leisurely; there's no rush. The experience is paramount. The castle offers many interactive activities that you can enjoy. Take your time to read the introductions. There is also a summer special exhibition called "Monster" to see.

4. Finally, visit the gift shop to buy some souvenirs, which is quite enjoyable.

Hiking  
The scenery in Helsingør is beautiful, making it ideal for hiking. I have added a hiking route from Komoot in the map, which includes passing by a small castle that is not open to the public, climbing up a hill to overlook the vast ocean from the summit, and enjoying the lush greenery and the natural oxygen-rich environment along the way.

Helsingør Public Museum  
We didn't actually enter the museum itself; instead, we spent 250 kroner on an experience box themed around Helsingør's wine culture. The box contained many items, including a map and a guidebook. You follow the map to each location and use the guidebook for activities. Inside the box, there were three bottles of wine, accompanied by wine glasses and a corkscrew, as well as many other items. Postcards were also included, making it an excellent option for exploring the city!

0201071.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend some popular attractions in Cologne, Germany.

Cologne Cathedral: When visiting Cologne, everyone heads straight for the cathedral, a Gothic architectural gem of medieval Europe. Majestic and solemn, it stands as if a black knight. Inside the cathedral, the statues carved on the tall pillars are intricately detailed, and the large stained-glass windows illustrate vibrant biblical stories, all of which are unique artistic treasures of the cathedral. This is also the spot where Jay Chou's famous shot was taken.

Hohenzollern Bridge is adorned with nearly 2 tons of love locks. It is one of Cologne's oldest railway and highway bridges, witnessing events from the 1990s and even the 1970s. This location offers the best vantage point for photographing the cathedral and the iron bridge together.

Ludwig Museum: It is said that the couple, Peter and Irene Ludwig, donated six to seven hundred works by Picasso, making it one of the top three museums in terms of the number of Picasso works. However, only a limited number are on display. Additionally, there are modern works by artists such as Dalí, Lichtenstein, and Warhol.

【Jellycat Shop】The largest JC store in Europe, but it still feels quite small. The pink exterior of the shop is very eye-catching, surrounded by blossoms. Although the store is small, it has everything you could need. I took home a cake bunny from the shop; they offer packaging in-store, and you can also pick up a bouquet of flowers.

Mangal Döner is a chain of Turkish kebab döner restaurants opened by German football star Podolski. The chain has already expanded to several cities in Germany, with more than one outlet in Cologne. The price is approximately 8-9 euros, and I ordered an open sandwich with beef, which was really delicious! It's the kind of "Western food" I wish to have again when I return home.

0201090.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a comprehensive travel guide for Sentosa Island in Singapore.

Preparations Before Departure  
The sun is strong on the island, and sun protection is essential. Be sure to prepare sunscreen and a hat. Carry some cash, as there are many delicious foods and shops on the island worth trying. Download the Sentosa Island map app to view the map and attraction recommendations at any time.

Itinerary

Itinerary One: Visit the attractions of Sentosa Island, such as Sentosa Island Hotel and Underwater World.

Itinerary Two: Experience water activities, such as the Royal Water Sports Center and kayaking.

Itinerary Three: Head to Universal Studios to enjoy thrilling amusement rides.
How to get there: Take a ferry from Singapore Ferry Terminal, and you can reach Sentosa Island in about 15 minutes! It's convenient and fast.

Attraction Highlights:

Water Adventure Park: The Water Adventure Park is the only water park in Southeast Asia that incorporates marine life elements, offering thrilling water slides.

S.E.A. Aquarium: The S.E.A. Aquarium is one of the largest aquariums in the world. Its highlight is the Ocean Window—a 36-meter-long, 8.3-meter-high viewing panel. Standing in front of the massive glass window is truly breathtaking. Visitors can observe various marine creatures, and the exterior resembles a maritime cultural museum, reflecting the local ethnic characteristics.

Universal Studios: Universal Studios Singapore on Sentosa Island is the second Universal Studios in Asia, featuring seven themed zones.

Tips:  
Time: Plan your itinerary in advance to avoid peak hours and better enjoy the island's scenery!  
Budget: Be mindful of budget control as the island offers a wide variety of activities and cuisine; you might go bankrupt without careful planning!  
Tickets: Purchase tickets in advance to avoid queues, save time, and fully enjoy the island's attractions!

0201068.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a two-day travel itinerary for Munich, including dining, accommodation, and transportation.

Day 1

Arrived at Munich Airport at 10 am, took the subway for 1 hour to the hotel.  
Accommodation: Hampton by Hilton Munich City West, 910 RMB for a twin room including breakfast for two. Overall quite nice, highly recommended!  
Asam Church: Free and truly impressive.  
Karlsplatz, Königsplatz, and Frauenkirche: Almost all located together.  
Old Pinakothek: Special price on Sundays for 1 Euro! Very worthwhile. If it were more expensive, I'd reconsider, haha. Checked off Van Gogh's Sunflowers and Fields.  
Watched the opera "Tosca": at the Bavarian State Opera. We bought the cheapest tickets for 16 Euros, only to find out they were standing tickets... The performance itself was great, and the venue was packed!!

Day 2

Maria Square: A must-visit attraction in Munich, featuring a medieval Fish Fountain.

Munich New and Old Town Halls: Includes performances!

New Town Hall (Neues Rathaus): Features the famous Glockenspiel, comprised of 43 bells and 32 life-sized figures of knights. Performances occur at 11 a.m., 12 p.m., and from March to October at 5 p.m., similar to a music box. The Glockenspiel was completed in 1908 and restored in 2007. The entire performance lasts around 15 minutes.

Old Town Hall (Altes Rathaus): Constructed in the 14th century in a neo-Gothic architectural style, it houses a toy museum spanning four floors. Nearby, there is a sculpture of Juliet.

St. Peter's Church: The oldest church in Munich, offering student tickets for 3 euros to climb to the top for a panoramic view of Munich.

Munich Residenz and Treasury (3 hours, on-site ticket purchase, combined ticket for both museums 13 euros): Luxurious and worth visiting! The palace of the Bavarian kings features magnificent architecture, invaluable works of art, and a treasury. With numerous exhibits to explore and photograph, it includes a free Chinese audio guide.

Music Square

DM Drugstore: A great place for shopping! Affordable! Allocate at least an hour to explore. The next issue will cover the must-buy items at DM.

Hacker Bridge for watching the sunset.
Regarding food: German roasted pork knuckle and beer are local specialties and are worth trying!

0201021.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please give me a travel guide for Turkey.

Hagia Sophia Church  
A model of Byzantine architecture and a symbol of Turkey
The Blue Mosque is the only mosque in the world with six minarets.

Istanbul Archaeological Museum  
Almost all of Istanbul's cultural relics are housed here.
Topkapi Palace: The old palace where successive sultans worked and resided.

Dolmabahçe Palace  
The largest palace in Turkey and the last manifestation of the glory of the Ottoman Empire, features the largest crystal chandelier in the world in its main hall.

Galata Tower  
During the day, one can overlook the beautiful Bosphorus Strait and the cityscape of Istanbul from the top of the Galata Tower. In the evening, there are also exceptionally splendid dance performances filled with ethnic characteristics.
The Anatolian Civilizations Museum has successfully become one of the few museums in the world to be distinguished by its unique collections.
The Temple of Artemis Ruins, one of the Seven Wonders of the World.

0201054.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with a travel guide for Brussels, Belgium.

Sightseeing Check-in:

Brussels Grand Place: Known as the most beautiful square in Europe, the Grand Place offers a 360-degree panoramic view with no blind spots. It's surrounded by Gothic, Renaissance, and Louis XIV architectural styles, making it quite spectacular!

Comic Strip Wall: The murals on this wall are themed as "comic strips," featuring classic characters and scenes from famous Belgian comic artists! Especially notable are the Adventures of Tintin, the Smurfs, etc.

Little Peeing Girl: Although it's not very elegant, since you're here, might as well take a photo. Legend has it that tossing a coin into the fountain symbolizes loyalty, virtue, and love!

Little Peeing Boy: This is also a very famous statue. There are souvenir shops around where you can buy various memorabilia of the peeing boy.

Galeries Royales Saint-Hubert: Inside the arcade, there are fashion stores, antique shops, and cafes, as well as a cinema built in 1847. The architecture is characterized by an Italian Renaissance style, which is very distinctive. 👍

Chocolate Museum: Showcasing the 4,000-year history of cocoa beans and chocolate, visitors can admire the traditional handmade chocolate-making process and also taste freshly made chocolate. Reservations are required in advance, and it is open from Tuesday to Sunday, 10:00 AM to 4:30 PM.

Culinary Recommendation:  
Le Funambule: The flavors offer a variety of choices. I ordered the strawberry and banana combination with cream. The crepe is relatively soft with a sweeter taste, perfect for those who enjoy sweet flavors. Give it a try!

Maison Dandoy: A famous waffle shop with a history of over a century. I ordered a cream berry and an ice cream berry. The waffle has a crispy exterior and a tender interior, and it is not overly sweet. The taste is quite good!

PIERRE MARCOLINI: Life Chocolate ‼️ The shop offers a wide variety of flavors, and you can purchase more if you like. We bought three small boxes of chocolates.

NEUHAUS: A chocolate shop established in 1857. We bought a box of dark chocolate; it is rich and full-bodied, melts in the mouth, with a pleasant bitterness and sweetness, offering a complex flavor profile.

Fries Atelier: A Michelin three-star fries restaurant in Brussels. If you're interested, you can visit it, though the taste isn't particularly remarkable.

Waffle Factory: The original flavor is quite ordinary, so it's recommended to choose one with a bit of flavor.

The Lobster House: The seafood platter is plentiful and very fresh. The accompanying bread dipped in the special sauce is delicious.

0201074.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a niche itinerary for a two-day, one-night self-driving tour in Meizhou.

Day 1: Shengpin Agarwood Museum - Youluo Street - Thousand Buddha Pagoda - Ketiange Venice

Shengpin Agarwood Museum: Known as the Little Mogao Caves, spend 40 minutes leisurely exploring. It's a place where you can find unique angles for photography. There is a parking lot available, and entry is free.

Youluo Street is quite similar to the Qilou buildings in Jiangmen. An hour of leisurely strolling in the old street should be enough. Parking in the narrow alley is easy to enter but difficult to exit.
The Thousand Buddha Tower is quite beautiful at sunset. The pavilions and terraces are also very photogenic, with layers upon layers of different scenery.
The night view at Venice in Keta World is quite beautiful. Location: Yuepin Four Seasons. After parking, go down the stairs to reach the photo spot. The lights are turned off promptly at 8:30 PM.

Day 2 Songkou Ancient Town - Hua'e Building - Pingshan Terraces

Songkou Ancient Town
The ancient town is rich in local customs and cultural atmosphere. The Songjiang Grand Hotel and a museum of overseas Chinese history and culture are notable attractions and worth visiting.

The Hua'e Tower is a bit far, with a winding mountain road that has eighteen turns. The drive is quite enjoyable, although the place is somewhat dilapidated. However, it is very photogenic here, located over a hundred kilometers from Fujian.
The Ping Shan Terraces have been abandoned. The scenery is quite beautiful and pleasant, but it is not recommended to explore recklessly.

0201093.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend to me an introduction to a scenic spot in Chongqing's Fairy Mountain and a guide for photography and leisure activities.

When considering summer resorts in Chongqing, Fairy Mountain is naturally the top choice. With an average elevation of 1900 meters and the highest peak reaching 2033 meters, the average temperature is about 22°C, making it feel very comfortable and cool during the hot summer days.

The main attractions include the Eye of the Forest, Interactive Experience Walkway, Cloud-top Descent, High-altitude Expansion, Vast Grasslands, Pusatuo, Tongtian Tower, Fairy Rock, and Fairy Pool. You can experience a rich anion-filled atmosphere, breathe in fresh air, and feel physically and mentally refreshed and relaxed.

Tickets: Approximately 50 yuan.  
Transportation Guide:  
Self-driving: You can drive yourself to the destination.  
Public Transportation: First, reach Wulong, then transfer to a shuttle bus to Fairy Mountain.

Photography and Travel Guide

Camping: The park features a designated camping area where tents are pre-assembled. The interesting "Cheerful Light Forest" event is held at the campsite, allowing visitors to enjoy activities such as afternoon tea in the woods, barbecue parties, moss hunting, and handicraft experiences, making for a very pleasant experience.

Petting Zoo: This place is perfect for bringing children. You can feed alpacas, ride horses, swing, and enjoy a go-kart parent-child experience, rediscovering the joys of childhood with your kids.

Back Mountain Stone Forest: The towering stone forest resembles a maze, with a striking contrast between the red maples and the dark stone formations. It's a fantastic spot for photography!

Sightseeing Mini Train: Ride the mini train across the Fairy Mountain Grassland, leisurely taking in the picturesque scenery outside the window, offering a very relaxing experience!

Tips:

Fairy Mountain Scenic Area is at a relatively high altitude, with unpredictable climate changes and significant temperature differences between day and night. It is advisable to prepare some warm clothing, as well as an umbrella or raincoat.

In summer, it is essential to take sun protection measures. Bring sunscreen, sunglasses, and a sun hat to avoid getting sunburned.

During the journey, you might experience acclimatization issues. It is recommended to prepare some essential medications before your trip.

There are usually fewer visitors in the morning, and it tends to be cooler. If you rise early, you can enjoy the sunrise and sea of clouds. If you have enough time in the afternoon, you can walk along the treetop path of the Forest's Eye to enjoy the sunset glow.

Hotel Recommendation:

Xian Nv Shan Zhuo Ya Hotel: This hotel is nestled within the Xian Nv Shan National Forest Park, exuding a strong sense of nature. The environment is beautiful, and the air is fresh.

Environment: The rooms are spacious and very clean, directly facing a large lawn where horses roam freely. Under the blue sky and white clouds, it resembles a dreamlike Swiss estate, perfect for photography.

Service: The butler-style service is very considerate, creating a comfortable experience. Guests are even given farewell gifts when they leave, showcasing exceptional hospitality.

0201029.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with a travel guide for a must-visit attraction in Dunhuang.
The Mogao Caves are incredibly awe-inspiring! It feels as though I have stepped into the documentary "Hexi Corridor."

Mingsha Mountain and Crescent Spring  
You can enter during sunrise or sunset, which prevents prolonged exposure to the sun. You can ride a camel across the desert, and there are also sand sliding and desert motorcycling activities available.

Yadan Devil City  
This place is located at a wind gap, where it seems as if devils are howling, hence the name Devil City. Purchasing a sunset ticket allows you to reach the end just as the sun sets, which is particularly spectacular.

Yumen Pass  
A crucial strategic pass on the Silk Road, known for the phrase "the spring breeze does not pass through Yumen Pass." It is more interesting when accompanied by an explanation.

The Thousand Buddha Caves here exude the charm of a post station and bear the traces of life. They are impressively captivating, comparable to the Mogao Caves, but with weaker preservation efforts; their future disappearance is uncertain.

Dunhuang's Three Major Performances:

✅ "See Dunhuang Again" - Located at the See Dunhuang Again Theater, 9 kilometers from the city center, this is a new highlight for Dunhuang cultural tourism. I can only say, it is a must-see❗️ Well worth it!

✅ "The Dunhuang Grand Ceremony" - Near Mingsha Mountain, themed around the Silk Road, it extols love in a grand manner. It is the only large-scale desert live performance in the Northwest.

✅ "Silk Road, Flower Rain" - At the Dunhuang Grand Theater, the dancers' exquisite costumes and graceful movements 💃 bring the murals of the Mogao Caves to life. Recommended for those who love dance or seek artistic inspiration in Dunhuang.

Dunhuang Cuisine

Shazhou Night Market: Sauced Sheep Head, Donkey Meat Yellow Noodles, Gunpowder Noodles, Apricot Peel Water, Jiayuguan Grilled Meat, Sand Onion Beef Pancakes, Whole Roasted Lamb, Grilled Fish, and Various Barbecues.

Siluo Apricot Peel Tea: Ice Egg Milk Sweet Wine, Fermented Glutinous Rice—all are Northwestern specialties.

Guohui Stewed Lamb with Cake: Stewed Lamb with Cake is a Dunhuang specialty, and the scrambled eggs with sand onions are quite unique!

Transportation: 24-hour dedicated shuttle service, ensuring ample rest.

Accommodation: Stay in star-rated hotels, ideally by Crescent Spring, for views of both sunrise and sunset.

0201035.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a few must-see attractions in Nyingchi to me.

Basum Tso: Snow Peaks, Lakes, Forests, and Gentle Hiking

Basum Tso is a renowned sacred lake in the Tibetan Nyingma (Red Sect) tradition, often praised as the "Turquoise Jewel Fallen into the Mortal World." Within the scenic area, there are numerous attractions, including the island in the center of the lake, Cuozong Gongba Monastery, Jieba Village, Cuogao Village, Xincuo, and Zhongcuo.

The best season to visit is autumn, when the sky is clear, the air is fresh, and the winds are gentle. From the lakeshore to the mountain ridges, the landscape is ablaze with vibrant autumn colors, offering a rich tapestry of hues and a serene environment.

"Sunlit Golden Mountain" at Mount Namjagbarwa  
Mount Namjagbarwa is the most representative peak of the Nyingchi region and also the highest peak in this area.  
Best viewing locations: Sejila Mountain Pass, Suosong Village within the Yarlung Tsangpo Grand Canyon  
Best viewing season: October to April of the following year. During this period, there is little rain, the air is dry, and visibility is high, allowing for a distant view of the most beautiful scenery of Mount Namjagbarwa.

Midui Glacier, Glacier, Snow Mountain, Forest

Midui Glacier is the world's lowest-altitude glacier and has been rated as one of the six most beautiful glaciers in China by "Chinese National Geography." It preserves ancient ice and snow that spans millions of years, with crystal-clear shimmering ice basins and sheer cliffs, and a long, dark blue ice tongue that is far more breathtaking than one can imagine. It is recommended to visit in the fall or winter!

【Yarlung Tsangpo Grand Canyon】 View Twin Peaks, Light Hiking, Scenic Photography

The Yarlung Tsangpo Grand Canyon stretches 504 kilometers in length, reaching a depth of 6,009 meters at its deepest point, making it the deepest canyon in the world. Within the Yarlung Tsangpo Grand Canyon scenic area, in addition to taking boat tours to view the canyon landscapes, there are also diverse and rich viewpoints for photography, offering the best location to observe Mount Namcha Barwa. Early May and early October are the optimal seasons for hiking.

Lulang Forest: Snow-capped mountains, vast forests, and pastoral fields.  
Lulang Forest consists of shrubs and dense spruce and pine trees flanked by green mountains on both sides. In the midst of the forest lies orderly meadows, earning it the reputation of a "natural oxygen bar."

[Bo Mi] Glaciers, Spruce Forests, Hiking

In the autumn in Bo Mi County, one can find the vibrant intertwining of colorful forests and pristine glaciers and snow-capped peaks decorating the landscape, accompanied by a blue sky and lakes that are overwhelmingly refreshing. Such rich autumn scenery makes it difficult to look away...

Starting in September, the area around the Gang Spruce Forest in Bo Mi gradually begins to embrace autumn colors. The peak of the autumn hues occurs from early October to mid-November, particularly along the Bo Mi section of the National Highway 318. Glaciers can be seen from a distance along the road, and their beauty is further accentuated by the brilliant autumn colors!

0201070.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend an itinerary for a one-day trip to Frankfurt.
Just one day is enough to check in at: Heidelberg - Rüdesheim - Rhine Valley Cruise - Church of the Holy Spirit - Altamira Alley - Assmannshausen - Rheinstein Castle.

Itinerary Overview  
🕓 8:30 Departure from Frankfurt  
🕓 9:30 Explore the Castle Gardens in Heidelberg  
Take the cogwheel train to the historic old castle, then enjoy the beautiful scenery in the gardens.  
🕓 11:00 The Old Bridge  
A Baroque stone bridge spanning the Neckar River. Don’t forget to touch the bronze monkey by the bridge.  
🕓 11:30 Market Square  
Here you can find the Hercules Fountain, Town Hall, and the Church of the Holy Spirit.  
🕓 12:00 Lunch Time  
🕓 13:00 Rüdesheim  
The quaint and exquisite town known as the "City of Wine." Explore Drosselgasse with its many specialty shops, small museums, and the small train station.  
🕓 15:30 Rhine River Cruise  
Enjoy a cruise along the Rhine River, with a view of the Rheinstein Castle from the disembarkation point.  
🕓 Around 16:00 Return to Frankfurt

Included Content:
Round-trip tour bus
Chinese-speaking guide
Daily departures available
Cheaper rates for larger groups

0201020.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a few attractions in Moscow for me.

Armed Forces Cathedral:  
If you're coming to Moscow, make sure to visit! It's located on the outskirts and requires a taxi to reach. You can contact friends via XHS to carpool together! Built in 2020, it aligns well with modern aesthetics. Unlike century-old churches, it retains traditional Russian aesthetics while featuring modernist architectural characteristics, and there are Chinese guides available inside.

National Military Museum:  
The entire museum surrounds the Cathedral of the Armed Forces. Inside, it chronicles the complete history of the former Soviet Union during World War II, covering 1,418 days with a walk of 1,418 steps to commemorate the victory in the war!

Moscow University:  
Book online in advance! Otherwise, you won't be allowed to visit!

Red Square/Lenin's Mausoleum:

Red Square is akin to Tiananmen Square, with quite strict security measures in place. To visit Lenin's Mausoleum, you need to store your luggage. Photography and speaking are not allowed, and you cannot linger.
Kremlin: The main attractions are the Grand Palace, the main cathedral, and an armory. The changing of the guard ceremony in front of the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier is truly worth anticipating!

GUM Department Store: The hundred-year-old department store shows no trace of age! It has a unique charm that makes you want to continuously take photos with your phone. The ice cream inside is truly delicious!
St. Basil's Cathedral: One of Moscow's iconic landmarks! The six onion-shaped domes, each in different colors, are truly beautiful when photographed under the glow of the setting sun!

Underground Palace Art:  
This is also a popular attraction in Moscow! The subway, which has been around for over a hundred years, no longer resembles an ordinary passenger vehicle; rather, it is more like a form of mural art. It is suitable for viewing as a leisurely activity after a meal.

0201037.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a few must-visit places in Dali for me.

Erhai Lake  
It is often said that in Dali, there are the flowers of Shangguan, the winds of Xiaguan, the snow of Cangshan, and the moon over Erhai Lake. If you visit Dali, you must see Erhai Lake. It is truly stunningly beautiful. There's no need to specifically visit Caicun or S-bend; any spot along the lakeside is exceptionally beautiful. You can cycle around the lake for a breezy ride, have a picnic by the shore, or take photos by the lakeside (it's best to wear bright colors—they turn out great in photos!).

Visit the Yin Qiao Market to experience the vibrant local atmosphere (the fruits and vegetables at the market are quite cheap), or go to the March Street or Chongdan Factory Market (which are more commercialized with relatively higher prices; for the March Street Market, it is recommended to go late in the afternoon around 6-7 PM, when vendors are starting to close and tend to sell goods at cheaper prices than during the day). In the evening, you can also visit Renmin Road in Dali Old Town to experience the bustling stall culture!

Shuanglang Ancient Town

Dali has many ancient towns, but I believe the most beautiful is Shuanglang Ancient Town. From any shop you choose to sit in, you can see Erhai Lake. You can also take a boat to the opposite Nanzhao Customs Island and gaze into the distance at the Sun Palace of Yang Liping!

Xizhou Ancient Town, unlike Shuanglang Ancient Town, is more primitive and exudes stronger ethnic characteristics. In the spring, one can witness golden waves of wheat and admire the century-old banyan tree, reputedly shedding red tears. In summary, it is definitely worth a visit!

Bird Hanging Mountain  
This place can be called the "Altay of Dali." It's very beautiful and photogenic, making it a great spot for photography. Currently, it is a good time for hiking and mushroom picking. It is advisable to hire a guide to accompany you, and afterward, you can enjoy a hot spring in Eryuan!

Six Yuan Café

This is a must-visit café in Dali. The American-style coffee is truly six yuan per cup. The café has a dog named Liuliu and several kittens. The café owner is very nice and regularly hosts "family feasts" where you can meet many new friends. The atmosphere is extremely pleasant!

Shaxi Ancient Town  
Visit the same Feng Courtyard as Liu Yifei. The mint coffee is very tasty. The ancient town is very quaint and not commercialized. Recommended for sisters who enjoy tranquility!

The Three Pagodas of Chongsheng Temple  
Dali's only 5A-level scenic area, indicative of its status. When worshipping Buddha, one should worship the true Buddha, and aside from the Guanyin of Mount Putuo, this is the place to do so! According to the tour guide, using the wind chimes here to pray is equivalent to praying for a lifetime!

Weishan Ancient Town, a nearby small city that can be reached from Dali in just 20 minutes by high-speed train, is also the hometown of Zhao Ling'er—the Nanzhao Kingdom—and the filming location of the TV drama "Chinese Paladin." Be sure to try the Weishan specialty, "One Noodle," which is super delicious and affordable!

Wuwei Temple
Visiting Wuwei Temple to have a vegetarian meal and experiencing the joy of eating vegetarian food - for me, I particularly enjoy the tranquil and serene atmosphere of the temple!

0201016.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with a 6-day, 5-night travel itinerary for Seoul and Busan!

Day 1: Arrival in Seoul  
🇲🇾 Depart from Kuala Lumpur International Airport, transit through Hanoi, and arrive at Incheon. Check in at the Arirang Hill Hotel, explore Myeongdong Art Street, shop at Olive Young, visit Gwangjang Market, and stroll around N Seoul Tower and Namsan Park.

Day 2: Nami Island - Nature and Adventure   
Interact with alpacas at Alpaca World, experience the rail bike, tour Nami Island, and visit Itaewon Street in the evening.

Day 3: History and Modernity  
Wear a hanbok and tour Gyeongbokgung Palace, enjoy ginseng chicken soup in Insa-dong, visit Starfield Library in Gangnam, see the Rainbow Fountain at Banpo Bridge, and visit DDP (Dongdaemun Design Plaza).

Day 4: Travel to Busan  
Take the train to Busan, check in at Almont Busan Hotel, visit Gamcheon Culture Village to see murals, explore Baekyang Culture Village, Jagalchi Market

Day 5: Beach and Leisure  
Dakbat Mural Village & 192 Stairs, Haeundae Beach, Coastal Train, Café Rooftop, Gwangalli Beach, Lotte Shopping

Day 6: Return Home  
🇲🇾 Depart from Busan, transit through Saigon, and return to KLIA.

Budget: RM4,200 All-Inclusive  
Airfare: RM1,531 (Vietnam Airlines)  
Accommodation: RM725  
Transportation: Train Ticket (Seoul-Busan) RM212  
Attractions: Nami Island Day Tour RM310  
Busan Capsule Train: RM45  
Miscellaneous: K-ETA RM36, Insurance RM72, Roaming RM58, Hanbok Rental RM35, T-Money RM16  
Remaining Budget: Dining, Subway Transportation, and Shopping

0201002.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with travel guides related to a few niche coastal cities within China.

Xiamen  
Duration: 3-5 days  
Budget: 1000+  
Recommended attractions: Haimen Memorial Park, Huangcuo Beach, Shili Longdyke, Guanyin Mountain Beach, Bay Park, Dadeji Bathing Beach, Zhangzhou Road Beach, Yefengzhai Beach, Xiamen University Baicheng Beach

Beihai Time: 2-3 days Budget: 800+ Recommended attractions: Silver Beach Park, Qiaogang Beach, Zixiawan Tourist Area, Guantouling, Golden North Coast Offshore Boardwalk, Weizhou Island's Dripping Danping, etc.

Qingdao  
Duration: 3 days  
Budget: 800+  
Recommended Attractions: No. 1, 2, 3, and 6 Bathing Beaches, Shilaoren Bathing Beach, Liuqing River Beach, Golden Beach Bathing Beach, Laoshan Shazikou

Wanning  
Duration: 3-4 days  
Budget: 800+  
Recommended attractions: Shimei Bay, Danyue Bay, Shenzhou Peninsula, Bali Village, Jiajing Island, Shanqin Bay, Shenzhou Peninsula Lighthouse, etc.

Shanwei

Duration: 2-3 days  
Budget: 700+  
Recommended Attractions: Windmill Island, Honghai Bay, Dahu Beach, Jindingwan Beach, Coastal Highway, Jinyu Bay, Baian Beach, Wanghaipo, etc.

Weihai

Duration: 2-3 days  
Budget: 850+

Dalian

Duration: 3-5 days  
Budget: 700+  
Recommended attractions: Xinghai Square, Zangwo Ridge, Silver Beach, Baihang Mountain Villa, Hongxing Sea, Diamond Bay, Fisherman's Square, etc.

Zhuhai

Duration: 3-4 days

Budget: 800+

Recommended attractions: Xianglu Bay Beach, Wai Lingding Island Tourist Resort, Zhuzai Beach, Guishan Island, and Dong'ao Island Tourist Resort, among others.

Shenzhen  
Duration: 2-3 days  
Budget: 1200+  
Recommended attractions: Jiaochangwei, Guanhu Village, Jinsha Bay, Dalu Bay, Xichong, Dameisha, Xiaomeisha, Dongchong, Haicaijiao, etc.

Taizhou  
Duration: 3-4 days  
Budget: 800+  
Recommended Attractions: Baishawan Seaside Park, Pearl Beach, Dongxia Beach, Nanmenkeng Beach, Shan Hai Zhi Yun in Wenling, Dachen Island, Longmen Beach, etc.

0201031.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a few must-visit attractions in Lanzhou.

Shifo Valley Forest Park is located in the Qilihe District of Lanzhou City. It boasts abundant vegetation, fresh air, and a unique Buddhist cultural atmosphere. Visitors can appreciate the magnificent mountain and water landscapes and experience the enchanting charm of nature.

The Shuimo Danxia Tourist Area is located in Yongdeng County, Lanzhou City, and is considered a treasure in the arid regions of northern China. It is primarily characterized by its red Danxia landforms, which are colorful and resemble an ink and wash painting, providing a delightful aesthetic experience.

Tulu Valley Forest Park is located in Yongdeng County, Lanzhou City. It is a tourist attraction that combines natural landscapes with cultural sites. Visitors can enjoy beautiful waterfalls, streams, and unique landforms here.

Xinglong Mountain is located in Yuzhong County, Lanzhou City, and is a renowned Taoist sacred site. The mountain is home to numerous temples and Taoist monasteries, where visitors can experience a rich religious and cultural atmosphere and enjoy the magnificent natural landscapes.

Baita Mountain Park is located in the Chengguan District of Lanzhou City. It is a park that combines historical, cultural, and natural landscapes. Within the park, there is a white pagoda and ancient buildings with a long history, making it an excellent place for visitors to appreciate the scenery of Lanzhou.

Kushui Town, located in Yongdeng County, Lanzhou City, is an ancient town with a long history and unique culture. Visitors can taste authentic Lanzhou cuisine and experience the charm of the ancient town here.

The Renshou Mountain Cultural Tourism Area, located in Anning District of Lanzhou City, is a tourist attraction themed around historical culture. It features ancient temples and beautiful landscapes, making it an excellent destination for visitors to learn about the history and culture of Lanzhou.

0201052.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with a two-day, one-night travel guide for Fenghuang Ancient Town.

[Regarding Transportation]  
High-Speed Rail: You can take a high-speed train to Fenghuang Ancient Town Station. After exiting the station, you can directly take a shuttle bus (7 yuan per person, half price for students) to the scenic area.  
Airplane: Fly from various locations to Tongren Fenghuang Airport. After exiting, take the airport shuttle bus directly to Fenghuang Ancient Town.   
Self-Driving: Navigate directly from your starting point to a parking lot near the ancient town: 40 yuan per day. No vehicles are allowed inside the ancient town, so you'll need to walk.

【About Eating and Accommodation】   
Accommodation: It is recommended to stay within the ancient town. There are many hostels and guesthouses inside the ancient town, where you can experience the atmosphere of the ancient town right outside your window.  
Dining: Shrimp cakes, blood curd duck, cured meat, beef noodles, Miao cakes, sour soup fish, bamboo tube milk tea, 1892 Dessert Shop, barbecue, etc.

【Two-Day Tour Itinerary】

Day 1: Nanhua Mountain Divine Phoenix Cultural Scenic Area -> Riverside Café -> Night Tour of Tuo River -> Riverside Bar Listening to Music and Having a Drink

Day 2: Wanshou Palace -> Hongqiao Wind and Rain Tower -> East Gate Tower -> Yang Family Ancestral Hall -> Chongde Hall -> Ancient City Museum -> Shen Congwen's Former Residence -> Xiong Xiling's Former Residence

[Recommended Check-in Points]

🔺 Nanhuamen: A landmark building of the ancient city, marking the boundary between the new and old Fenghuang City. Entering Nanhuamen, you are in the ancient Fenghuang City, while exiting leads you to the new urban area. 

🔺 Tuo River: Known as the mother river of the ancient Fenghuang City, the banks of the Tuo River light up spectacularly at night, creating a beautiful scene with dim, twinkling lights. In the evening, you can also take a boat ride to enjoy the night view. 

🔺 Miao Stilted Buildings: The bluestone roads and stilted buildings add a taste of the Jiangnan region, and when combined with the misty rain, the scenery becomes even more enchanting. 

🔺 Nanhua Bridge: This is the highest point in the ancient city. From the bridge, you can see the Snow Bridge, Jumping Stones, and Rainbow Bridge, encompassing the beautiful scenery of the ancient city. 

🔺 Former Residence of Shen Congwen: Fenghuang Ancient City is the hometown of Shen Congwen, and here is his preserved small residence where he once lived. 

🔺 Former Residence of Xiong Xiling: An ancient Miao-style building centered around an atrium, you can explore the personal and work items used by Xiong Xiling in his earlier life.

Travel Tips:

The ancient town is divided into upper, middle, and lower sections. The upper and lower sections are peaceful, while the middle section is a bustling area.

There are many places to rent costumes in the ancient town. During the off-season, renting a costume with makeup and styling costs about 50 yuan.

There are travel photography shops where costumes and makeup are included, and they also provide professional photographers.

0201077.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a must-visit tourist attraction in Guilin and provide me with a detailed travel guide for it.

Ten-Mile Gallery

All the attractions here are free of charge. Renting a vehicle allows you to spend a day experiencing the leisurely life of Guilin.

Longji Rice Terraces

It is recommended to stay one night and then wake up early to see the morning view of the Longji Rice Terraces. In the morning, the terraces are shrouded in mist, resembling a fairyland.

Xingping-Lijiang River

For a tour of the essential section of the Lijiang River from Xingping to Jiuma, you can either take a bamboo raft or a cruise ship. Personally, I recommend the bamboo raft. During the journey, you will pass by the vantage point featured on the 20 yuan banknote, so remember to bring a 20 yuan note for photos! The Huangbu Reflection scenic area is also very beautiful. A visit to Guilin is incomplete without experiencing the Lijiang River.

Yulong River: Without the hustle and bustle of the city, everything is so primitive and natural, with an ancient simplicity and purity, it truly stands as the largest natural landscape garden in the Guilin area.

Elephant Trunk Hill  
The emblem of Guilin City, it is named after a giant elephant that appears to be drinking water from the Lijiang River.

The ancient town of Xingping is home to eight major scenic areas, including Nine Horse Fresco Hill, Snail Hill Lotus Cave, and Tianshui Stronghold Lingbao Pavilion, offering a total of 24 scenic spots, undoubtedly including one that you will like.

Yangshuo West Street

West Street is particularly interesting to visit at night, as it becomes very crowded. There are many unique bars that are ideal for having a drink and experiencing the customs and culture of Guilin.

Donggu Waterfall

The Gulong Waterfall's creek is crystal clear and remains abundant throughout the year. The forest area is filled with towering ancient trees and captivating red maples. Visitors can experience climbing the mountain while being doused by the waterfall, providing the sensation of moving against the current.

The Sun and Moon Twin Pagodas

The Sun and Moon Pagodas in Guilin are also known as the Gold and Silver Pagodas, or the Couple's Pagodas. The Sun Pagoda is also called the Gold Pagoda, and the Moon Pagoda is also known as the Silver Pagoda, hence they are collectively referred to as the Gold and Silver Pagodas. The Sun and Moon Twin Pagodas are situated in the beautiful Shan Lake in Guilin, and the reflection of the pagodas in the lake's water can quickly become a highlight on social media.

0201056.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with a half-day tour itinerary for Luxembourg.

First, Luxembourg is very small and there's not much to do. However, if you want to visit this tiny country as a check-in point, there are still places to take photos! 

Chem. de la Corniche: It is a road that requires climbing up, and the slope is quite steep, which made me exhausted (an exaggeration). We arrived at around 11:30 in the morning. With the sunlight shining on the river, you can capture the sparkling reflections!

Golden Girl Statue: Do not purchase refrigerator magnets from the small shop next to the Golden Girl Statue. At 6 euros each, they are quite expensive. However, since we visited on a Sunday and many shops were closed, we feared that we might miss the opportunity, so we bought them. As it turns out, souvenir shops near the Grand Ducal Palace were open and offered similar items at a cheaper price and with more attractive designs.

The Mudam Luxembourg - Musée d’Art Moderne Grand-Duc Jean: Free student tickets🆓. We visited because we had nowhere else to go. Its highlight is that it was designed by I. M. Pei on the site of a fortress. On the day we went, the exhibition halls had very little content and were quite boring, with almost no paintings. The design of the museum itself was more interesting. 

Note: I think the Panoramic Elevator of the Pfaffenthal is also optional. The entire ride takes just a few seconds, and although there's a transparent viewing platform, there's not much worth photographing.

Pont du Grund: The scenery is somewhat average, as you can tell from the photos I took. The accommodation was booked on Booking.com at the Hotel Grauate. It was very good and clean, not very close to the center but conveniently accessible (anyway, transportation is free wherever you go, haha).

0201024.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with a "cost-effective" 7-day, 6-night itinerary for Mauritius.
Day 1: Arrive in Mauritius, including an English-speaking driver for a private airport transfer to the hotel.
Day 2: 45-minute helicopter tour to view the underwater waterfall
Day 3: Speedboat Dolphin Chase + Whale Watching + Pier Lunch + Casela Wildlife Park + Walk with Lions
Day 4: Eastern Deer Island Catamaran Water Activities (Underwater Walking + Paragliding + Rafting + Onboard BBQ)
Day 5: Blue Bay Snorkeling + Glass-Bottom Boat + Lunch + Natural Bridge + Natural Bridge Tandem ATV
Day 7: Port Louis (Fort Adelaide, Aquarium, Caudan Waterfront) + Lunch + Red Roof Chapel

Preparation items before departure:

• Documents: Passport, hotel reservation, round-trip flight itinerary (needs to be printed)

• Abroad: Yellow and white immigration cards (distributed on the plane, fill out before landing)

• Medication: Cold medicine, heatstroke medicine, motion sickness medicine, diarrhea medicine, and other common medications; mosquito repellent products such as floral water and balm

• Sun protection: Aloe vera gel, hydrating face masks, and other after-sun repair products; sun-protective clothing, sun hats

Essential Information Before Departure:

- Smoking is strictly prohibited indoors throughout Mauritius; however, you may smoke outdoors where there is no roof.
- Mauritius follows a tipping system. It is customary to leave a tip of 25-100 rupees on the bedside before departing the hotel in the morning.
- Most hotels in Mauritius consider items like toothbrushes and razors as personal belongings, so they are typically not provided by the hotel. It is advisable to bring your own.
- Many hotels in Mauritius have their own beaches. Do not touch marine life casually when in the ocean. Simply observe them, as they will not actively attack humans!

0201095.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a two-day, one-night itinerary for purely eating and exploring within Xi'an city.

Day 1: After arriving in Xi'an in the morning, proceed to the hotel for check-in and take a short rest. In the afternoon, visit the Shaanxi History Museum, followed by a trip to the Big Wild Goose Pagoda, where you can visit the Da Ci'en Temple and choose to climb the pagoda. In the evening, dine at a restaurant near the Big Wild Goose Pagoda to enjoy Shaanxi cuisine and taste distinctive local beverages. After dinner, head to the Tang Paradise to appreciate the night scenery and performances.

Day 2:

In the morning, head to the Xi'an Bell Tower to appreciate the architecture of the Bell Tower and Drum Tower. Afterwards, you can stroll around the nearby shopping malls or streets and experience the commercial atmosphere of Xi'an. At noon, savor Xi'an's specialty cuisine nearby, the "Sanqin Set Meal." In the afternoon, you may visit the Xi'an Museum or return to the hotel to rest, concluding a pleasant journey.

Recommended Local Foods in Xi'an:
- Roujiamo (Chinese Hamburger)
- Hulutou Paomo (Intestine and Bread Soup)
- Youpo Lazi Huoguo (Oil-splashed Spicy Hot Pot)
- Liangpi (Cold Skin Noodles)

0201100.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a few must-visit attractions in Enshi for me.

Ping Shan Canyon  
Praised by National Geographic as China’s most beautiful fairyland, the "China's Semporna" gained widespread online fame due to a photo of a small wooden boat floating on the water. The canyon is deep and serene, with rippling green waves. Visitors can also enjoy the exhilarating experience of a light boat passing through a myriad of mountains.  
✔️ Must-visit spots: Yixian Sky, Suspended Glass Boat, Bijin Cliff.

Enshi Grand Canyon  
This location is a museum of karst landscapes and is considered the Colorado of the East. Above, there are cliffside walkways and the ancient "Yizhuxiang," with the world's most beautiful scar—Yunlong Crack—below.

✔️ Must-visit points: Yizhuxiang, Yunlong Crack's "Waterfall," the "Xiaomanyao Vertical Elevator," and the cliffside walkway.

Tusi City  
The largest and most well-preserved ancient architectural complex of the Tujia ethnic group in China. Experience the charm of the ethnic minorities firsthand.  
✔️Must-visit spots: Dong ethnic Wind and Rain Bridge, Linjun Temple, Tusi Palace - Jiujin Hall, Bell Tower, Drum Tower

The Earth Core Valley is a hidden gem travel destination in Enshi for those who love exploring mountains and waters. It not only features the widely popular cliff-side glass houses but also invites you to encounter the Heart of Romance at 30 degrees north latitude. 

✔️Must-visit spots: Heart-shaped Pool, Glass Skywalk, Cliff Hotel, and Aerial Magic Carpet.

Suobuya Stone Forest immerses itself in the underwater relics from 460 million years ago. Surrounded by verdant screens, it is a narrow and mysterious realm where fossilized remnants are visible everywhere.  
Essential spots to visit: Lotus Village, Nine Dragons Convergence, Mozi Valley, and Qinglong Terrace.

Tenglong Cave

It is the largest explored karst cave in Asia and can accommodate up to 700 million people. Outside the cave, a dragon lies swallowing the river; inside, the cave is bottomless. There are hidden mountains within the cave, and within the mountains, there are more caves.

Must-see attractions: Hot air balloon flights, laser shows, Tujia song and dance performances.

The Cruise on Qingjiang River

The enchanting beauty of the Great Qingjiang River, with its captivating scenery and charming allure, has been praised by tourists from both home and abroad as the most beautiful river of the Tujia people. 

Essential Attractions: Butterfly Cliff, the Great Qingjiang River, Butterfly Sea of Clouds.

Deer Courtyard  
Experience the secluded sinkhole village, and feel the tranquility and surprise brought by its deep gorges and murmuring waterfalls.  
✔️Must-visit spots: Five-tier Waterfall, Deer Drinking Pool, Xuanlu Crevice

0201086.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please recommend a proper travel guide to conquer Guizhou with a budget of over 1000 per person.

Regarding Transportation:
Airplane: Nationwide flights to Longdongbao Airport in Guizhou. It is recommended to choose Guiyang as your first stop, as it is convenient for visiting various attractions.  
Train: There are five train stations in Guizhou - Guiyang Station, Guiyang East Station, Guiyang North Station, Guiyang South Station, and Guiyang West Station. You can go directly to Guiyang Station, which is relatively close to the bustling areas.  
Bullet Train/High-Speed Rail: Guiyang East Station and Guiyang North Station directly reach Guiyang North Station, which is slightly closer to the city center.

Travel Itinerary  
Arrive in Guiyang → Jiaxiu Tower → Check into hotel  
Libo Xiaoqikong Scenic Area → Xijiang Qianhu Miao Village  
Xijiang Qianhu Miao Village → Zhenyuan Ancient Town  
Huangguoshu Waterfall → Anshun Colorful Guizhou City → Qingyan Ancient Town → Return Journey

Guizhou Attractions:  
Huangguoshu Waterfall: It is the largest waterfall in China. Standing in front of the waterfall, you can better appreciate its magnificent scenery. The sensation of water sprays brings refreshing coolness and leaves one deeply impressed.

Libo Xiaoqikong: Known as the earthly green gemstone, the lake waters are crystal clear, with lush green trees providing shade, it resembles a paradise on earth and is an excellent choice for family trips. Remember to wear comfortable shoes, as walking is required to explore many attractions within the scenic area.

Fanjing Mountain: A masterpiece of nature, a real-life version of Castle in the Sky. Climbing to the summit feels like being amidst the clouds, allowing one to experience the wonders of nature. As a sacred Buddhist site, attractions such as the Golden Summit and Mushroom Stone offer breathtaking beauty.

Qingyan Ancient Town: It features ancient architectural complexes from the Ming and Qing dynasties, with a rich historical atmosphere. It is very much worth a visit. Strolling through the streets of the ancient town, one can feel the charm of history.

Xijiang Qianhu Miao Village: A must-see for Guizhou tourism, it is the largest Miao ethnic village in the world. The night view resembles a real-life version of "Spirited Away," exceptionally beautiful.

Zhenyuan Ancient Town: A collection of historical sites known as the "Venice of the East." The river flows through the town, with antique-style buildings arranged in an orderly yet picturesque manner.

Precautions:

The weather in Guizhou changes rapidly, so be sure to prepare an umbrella, raincoat, and a light jacket.

Avoid wearing high heels when traveling, as Guizhou consists mostly of mountainous areas with numerous curves; comfortable athletic shoes are recommended.

The attractions are relatively far apart, and you will spend a significant amount of time in the vehicle. It's advisable to prepare motion sickness medication.

In Guizhou, the temperature can fluctuate considerably, so be sure to bring one or two jackets when you visit. The ultraviolet rays are strong in Guizhou regardless of the season (spring, summer, autumn, or winter), so it's essential to take sun protection measures.

Xiaoqikong is very beautiful, but the roads are damp and slippery, so watch your footing to avoid falling.

Gourmet Delights:

Sour Fish Soup: A specialty dish from Guizhou, characterized by its tangy and spicy flavor.

Huaxi Beef Noodles: The soup is fresh and delicious, and the beef is tender.

Silk Baby (Si Wa Wa): Refreshing and tasty, with a variety of side dishes.

Romantic Tofu Balls: The name is unique and the taste is quite good.

0201043.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with a few attractions and travel tips for Austria.

Famous Attractions and Routes:  
D1. Vienna State Opera: The music temple of Vienna.  
D2. Schönbrunn Palace: A royal residence in the suburbs of Vienna.  
D3. Salzburg: The hometown of Mozart, featuring many historical buildings and museums.

D4. Hallstatt Lake: Known as the "most beautiful small town in the world."

D5. Graz Old Town: A major city in Austria, it has preserved the complete appearance of the medieval era.

D6. St. Wolfgang Lake District: Renowned for its beautiful lakes and mountains, as well as its fairytale-like castles.

D7. Wachau Valley: One of Europe's most beautiful valleys, offering stunning views of the Danube River.  
D8. Alpine Ski Resorts: Such as Kitzbühel and Lech, a paradise for skiing enthusiasts.  
D9. Innsbruck: Situated at the foot of the Alps, it features the famous Golden Roof and the Swarovski Crystal Museum.

Best Time:

Spring (March-May): A season suitable for hiking and cycling all year round.

Summer (June-August): The ideal season for swimming, boating, fishing, and kayaking.

Autumn (September-November): The best season for enjoying gourmet food and vineyard scenery.

Winter (December-February): The best season for skiing and other winter sports.

Transportation Guide: 

Train: 
1. Salzburg -> Attnang-Puchheim -> Steeg-Gosau, then transfer to bus route 542. 
2. Salzburg -> Attnang-Puchheim -> Hallstatt, then take a boat to the town.

Bus: Take bus route 150 from Salzburg.

Driving: Self-drive.

0201048.caption: Please show results in interleaved images and texts.Please provide me with a travel guide for Pingyao.

Main attractions: Shilou, Ming and Qing Street, Wenmiao (Confucian Temple), Rishengchang, Ancient City Wall, County Office, Shuanglin Temple, Chenghuang Temple, Biaoju (Armed Escort Agency), and Again See Pingyao.

Detailed Itinerary  
DAY 1: County Office → City God Temple → Confucius Temple → South Street (Security Escort Office and Xietongqing) → City Tower (a must-visit) → Qingxu Temple → Ancient City Wall (enter at Yingxun Gate, descend via Yunlu Old Street) → Light Show at Yingxun Gate at 9 PM (arrive early ❗️)

Day 2: Rishengchang → Erlang Temple → See You Again, Pingyao (No performances on Monday) → Shuanglin Temple (near the train station) → Return trip (The itinerary direction can be adjusted according to your starting point; I am starting from the South Gate)

Ticket Purchase Guide

Visiting the ancient city without entering the attractions is free! There are a total of 22 attractions, with an all-access ticket priced at 125 RMB per person. Students can get tickets at half price, and those over 60 years old can enter for free.
